finding: The study confirmed that rs139242164 had a maternal-specific association with thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) levels. This variant was located near the maternally expressed GNAS gene, which is known to be associated with pseudo-hypoparathyroidism and high circulating TSH levels.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The SNP rs1799990 was identified as a genome-wide significant determinant of clinical duration in sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD), showing a p-value of 3.45×10^-36 and a beta of 0.34 in an additive model. It was recognized as the outstanding candidate affecting clinical duration, with further analysis confirming its significance in various genetic models.
title: Genome wide association study of clinical duration and age at onset of sporadic CJD

finding: The rs200383755 variant in GATA5 correlated with lower FEV1 and was also associated with increased asthma risk, heightened blood pressure, and diminished risk of benign prostatic hyperplasia in phenome-wide association studies.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association study improves resolution of genes, pathways and pleiotropy for lung function and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease

finding: The study reported significant evidence of an association between the <italic>ADA</italic><sup><italic>2</italic></sup> allele, represented by the SNP rs73598374, and obesity, defined as a BMI greater than 25 kg/m<sup>2</sup>, specifically observing this association in the Latino adult population. However, this association was not observed in the Caucasian population, suggesting that the <italic>ADA</italic><sup><italic>2</italic></sup> allele could contribute to obesity risk and its complications such as diabetes mellitus type 1 (DM1) in Latinos.
title: Association of Adenosine Deaminase (ADA) +22 G->A (rs73598374) Genotype in Latino Adult Obese

finding: The SNP rs6013897 fell within an intergenic region between CYP24A1 and BCAS1, suggested from Hi-C data to interact with CYP24A1, highlighting its importance in bone mineral density.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs927059, associated with femur neck BMD, showed prioritization of PAX1 as a candidate gene, emphasized by consistent eQTL results.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs199806394 exhibited dominant genetic effects affecting retinal thickness measurements. This association provided insights into how genetic variations can influence ophthalmic phenotypes.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: The rs17857295 SNP in MAVS was associated with an increased risk of developing invasive pulmonary aspergillosis (IPA) in HSCT recipients, particularly when the variant was present in the donor in a recessive genetic model.
title: MAVS expression in alveolar macrophages is essential for host resistance against Aspergillus fumigatus

finding: Identified at 20q11.21 and related to the <italic>CBFA2T2</italic> gene, this SNP exhibited strong statistical significance in relation to PSA levels.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: Detected at 20q11.21 in the <italic>CDK5RAP1</italic> gene, this SNP was part of identified significant variants, enhancing understanding of PSA-level determinants.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: In a trans-ethnic analysis, rs910083 on chromosome 20 was shown to be associated with nicotine dependence in a cohort of 28,677 European and 9,925 African-American smokers.
title: Genetic insights into smoking behaviours in 10,558 men of African ancestry from continental Africa and the UK

finding: The BP allele of rs3829704 was associated with decreased expression of PRPF6 in blood cells (Lymphocyte P = 1.29×10^-31, Blood P = 3.95×10^-11, Blood-T cell CD4+ activated P = 1.48×10^-7) and also showed decreased expression in the brain (Cortex P = 1.2×10^-6, Caudate P = 6.0×10^-6).
title: Pathway-based polygenic score analysis identifies the NRF2-KEAP1 and mRNA splicing - minor pathways as enriched in shared genetic variation between chronotype and bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs910805 was found to be associated with reduced expression of TCONS_00530677, an isoform of the XRN2 gene. This association was consistent in both adult and fetal brain datasets, suggesting that the risk-increasing allele G, which is also the minor allele, correlated with decreased expression of the isoform. This finding was particularly relevant as it provided new insights into genetic mechanisms underlying autism spectrum disorder (ASD).
title: Multivariate variance components analysis uncovers genetic architecture of brain isoform expression and novel psychiatric disease mechanisms

finding: this SNP was related to CDK5RAP1 and contributed to the genetic insights of substance use disorder.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The study identified a locus at rs76458410, associated with pulse pressure (PP) through short sleep duration (STST) interaction. This locus was driven by the YWHAB gene, with significant interaction evidence (P_GxE=6.4×10^-7).
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: Evidence of interaction at rs112958007 with STST for PP was significant (P_GxE=1.3×10^-9), linked to the PAK5 gene in Hispanic populations.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The SNP rs16991615 was highlighted as significant only in females, mapping to the MCM8 gene which encodes a DNA helicase important for DNA repair and was associated with estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs6031351 was associated with Androgen Receptor (AR) expression in triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC). In studies, AR expression had significant prognostic associations, indicating that patients with certain alleles of this SNP showed varying levels of AR expression, which correlated with patient outcomes.
title: Molecular Profiling of a Triple-negative Breast Cancer Cohort in India for EGFR and AR expression analyzed for patient outcomes showed a distinct subset of cellular co-expression

finding: This SNP demonstrated a significant association with PSA levels in the African ancestry cohort (β=-0.0423, p=8.7e-13) but was not significant in the European ancestry cohort, thus highlighting its unique association in the African population.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: This SNP, a missense variant in RRBP1, was involved in routing protein processing and was also recognized as a CAD sentinel variant, linking protein processing to CAD risk.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: While rs2207132 was the sentinel variant related to LDL-cholesterol and adiposity, it was linked to CAD risk and emphasized the importance of cholesterol pathways.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: This strongly correlated variant was identified in a region annotated as a likely enhancer for MAFB, highlighting its involvement in CAD.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The missense variant rs530872363 G>A (p.Asp25Asn) in the RTF2 gene exhibited damaging predictions from in silico tools and was found in homozygous state in both affected siblings. Although not previously linked to ID, there was moderate evidence suggesting its role in a genetic disorder, and the mutations were found more frequently within the South Asian genetic ancestry, aligning it as a strong candidate for further investigation.
title: Rare splice and missense variants with evidence of pathogenicity in consanguineous families with autosomal recessive intellectual disability from Pakistan

finding: Mapped to the ATP9A gene, this SNP showed significant association with ME/CFS. It was also replicated in the Verbal Interview cohort, which further supported its role in the disease.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: This SNP, mapping to the SULF2 gene, was replicated in the fibromyalgia cohort, linking it to both ME/CFS and fibromyalgia.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: Located proximal to KCNG1 and the lncRNA AL121785.1, the SNP rs4809823 was found to provide protective effects against Alzheimer's disease, and KCNG1 was predicted to be a hub gene in immune pathways pertinent to AD.
title: Identification of 16 novel Alzheimer’s disease susceptibility loci using multi-ancestry meta-analyses of clinical Alzheimer’s disease and AD-by-proxy cases from four whole genome sequencing datasets

finding: The SNP rs56817213 was identified in the Million Veteran Program study, marking it as one of the multi-ancestry loci for suicide attempt with a p-value of 3.64×10⁻⁹, indicating a strong statistical association.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: The CASS4:rs6024870-A variant was identified as protective in individuals of Complex Admixture History with respect to Alzheimer's disease.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: The SNP rs13040652 was associated with the development of immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI) therapy-related pneumonitis in patients undergoing treatment for non-small cell lung cancer. This finding was part of a larger study that utilized deep learning techniques to predict post-surgical complications associated with immunotherapy, demonstrating significant implications for patient outcomes.
title: A novel prediction model for immunotherapy induced pneumonitis prediction based on Chest CT and electronic health record

finding: The SNP rs117361510 was indicated to affect type 2 diabetes risk, which was part of the broader analysis of relevant common variants contributing to disease burden, although detailed DALY contributions were not specified.
title: Genetic risk factors have a substantial impact on healthy life years

finding: The SNP rs13040598 exhibited a positive finding in terms of overcoming T-cell dysfunction during adoptive immunotherapy. It was noted that this SNP may influence the therapeutic efficacy of T cell treatments by improving T cell expansion strategies and is discussed in the context of T-cell dysfunction limitations in the work of Janelle and Delisle (2021).
title: Combined PD-L1 and TIM-3 blockade improves the expansion of fit human CD8+ antigen-specific T cells for adoptive immunotherapy

finding: The SNP rs6062847 was associated with the NTSR1/SLCO4A1 locus and demonstrated a significant connection to both chronic dry cough and ACEi-induced cough, reaching significance according to Bonferroni correction.
title: Genomics of chronic cough unravels neurological pathways

finding: The SNP rs143384 was associated with several topics identified through the treeLFA models. Specifically, it was highlighted in a tree structure of inferred topics, showing a significant correlation with certain disease topics categorized under metabolic syndrome and other health conditions. The analysis indicated that most topics associated with rs143384 were clustered together in the same branch of the topic tree, and effect sizes for this SNP were reported through topic-GWAS, illustrating its importance in understanding the aetiology of complex traits.
title: Topic modelling with ICD10-informed priors identifies novel genetic loci associated with multimorbidities in UK Biobank

finding: The rs6012624 SNP was identified as a candidate causal variant associated with ST-segment amplitude in a GWAS study. It was positioned within open chromatin in cardiomyocytes and was predicted to alter chromatin accessibility, suggesting it plays a role in the transcriptional regulation of genes influencing the ST-segment.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: The rs6019764 SNP was also identified as a candidate causal variant related to ST-segment amplitude in the same GWAS. Like rs6012624, it was found in an open chromatin region in cardiomyocytes and was predicted to affect chromatin accessibility, thereby impacting gene regulation at the KCNB1 locus.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: The rs2229006 SNP, located within the coding region of KCNB1, was heterozygous and identified as having a significant allelic expression bias. The variant allele (C) was 3.8-fold more abundant than the reference (G) allele in the presence of the delinsTCCC variant, indicating a role in enhanced expression of KCNB1 due to the influence of a de novo enhancer.
title: An autosomal dominant cardiac arrhythmia syndrome, ST Depression Syndrome, is caused by the de novo creation of a cardiomyocyte enhancer

finding: The variant rs6062847-T was significantly associated with increased risk of chronic dry cough, indicating shared genetic determinants between ACEI-induced cough and chronic cough phenotypes.
title: Genome-wide association study of ACE inhibitor-induced cough implicates neuropeptides and shows genetic overlap with chronic dry cough

finding: The SNP rs7274134 in LINC01427 - LINC00261 demonstrated a significant association with insulin resistance (IR) under the dominant model. Individuals with the C/T-T/T genotypes had an OR of 2.60 (95% CI 1.37-4.96; p < 0.0032), indicating elevated risk of IR.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Insulin Resistance Risk in Normal BMI Indians

finding: The SNP rs6066146 located in gene EYA2 was identified as a significant finding in the primary GWAS related to diabetic retinopathy (DR). It showcased a p-value of 4.21 × 10−8 and was associated with the development of DR. This association was highlighted by tissue expression analysis indicating significant involvement in 'spleen' and suggested a potential role of EYA2 in retinal vascularization.
title: Multiple genome-wide association studies of type 2 diabetes implicate several genes are associated with diabetic retinopathy based on UK Biobank

finding: The rs750318549 SNP in ASXL1 was associated with reduced lifespan with a hazard ratio of 2.5 and a p-value of 2.3 x 10^-15.
title: Genetic associations with human longevity are enriched for oncogenic genes

finding: This SNP, located in the CHRNA4 gene on chromosome 20, showed a significant p-value of 7.34E-22, supporting its role in tobacco use and its relation to nicotinic acetylcholine receptors.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: This SNP in the CHRNA4 gene on chromosome 20 showed significant replication of findings, associated with TUD with a p-value of 9.27E-09 in the AA population.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs6112068, associated with DTD1, showed significant evidence of association with endometriosis at a P-value of 8.72E-10.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The variant rs17265513 located in ZHX3 was found to be significantly associated with endometriosis, with a P-value of 5.58E-09, marking it as an original finding.
title: Expanding the genetic landscape of endometriosis: Integrative -omics analyses uncover key pathways from a multi-ancestry study of over 900,000 women

finding: The SNP rs1799990 was prioritized as the tier 1 risk gene in the PRNP locus due to being a common missense variant (p.Met129Val) associated with sCJD risk, showing a protective G allele was linked with reduced risk and more slowly progressive phenotypes.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The SNP rs143384 exhibited the most significant association with knee pain in the primary GWAS, showing a p-value of 4.68 × 10^-19. It was replicated in the FinnGen cohort with a significant p-value of 3.57 × 10^-1. The association indicated that this SNP affects the expression levels of the GDF5 gene, which plays a crucial role in cartilage homeostasis and has been linked to osteoarthritis susceptibility.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Knee Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: A positive original finding was identified at rs4809370, which was linked to a second independent association on chromosome 20, near ZBTB46. This variant was associated with preeclampsia and exhibited an odds ratio of 1.08 with a highly significant p-value of 1.4×10^-8.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis identifies novel maternal risk variants and enables polygenic prediction of preeclampsia and gestational hypertension

finding: The presence of rs6070628 within <italic>MIR298</italic> was correlated with higher CSF levels of phosphorylated tau (p-tau181) in a dose-dependent manner, indicating a potential role in tau pathology associated with AD.
title: A multi-omics approach identifies a blood-based miRNA signature of cognitive decline in two large observational trials

finding: The genetic variant rs259983 was found to predispose individuals to both preeclampsia (PE) and hypertension (HTN), indicating shared genetic risk factors for both conditions.
title: Spatially Constrained Gene Regulation Identifies Key Genetic Contributions of Preeclampsia, Hypertension and Proteinuria

finding: The SNP rs45577437 on chromosome 20q11.22 was found to be exonic to ZNF341, with a significant association (p=1.21×10^{-14}), predicting a missense variant that could affect protein function related to immunity.
title: A genome-wide association study of adults with community-acquired pneumonia

finding: The SNP rs150607032, associated with ATP9A/NFATC2/SALL4, interacted with STST relative to TG levels, showing a significant genetic association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs73319497 SNP interacted with STST concerning TG levels, demonstrating a significant association.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The variant rs2876034, associated with critical COVID-19, showed an OR=0.95, indicating its role in the CASC20 locus.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: This variant was noted to be in strong LD with the sentinel variant rs2876034, relating it to critical COVID-19 associations.
title: Novel risk loci for COVID-19 hospitalization among admixed American populations

finding: SNP rs6120777 in MYH7B was associated with increased native myocardial T1 time (P = 9.2×10−11). MYH7B is related to hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, highlighting its role in myocardial remodeling.
title: Genetics of Myocardial Interstitial Fibrosis in the Human Heart and Association with Disease

finding: At 20q13.33, this novel variant was linked to lung cancer and smoking propensity, showcasing its independent genetic susceptibility role in lung cancer.
title: Genetic analysis of lung cancer reveals novel susceptibility loci and germline impact on somatic mutation burden

finding: Rs2232613 was identified in association with LBP levels, showing a pronounced downward shift in protein levels in the presence of this variant.
title: Plasma Proteome Variation and its Genetic Determinants in Children and Adolescents

finding: The SNP rs74828248 was significantly associated with TB status with a p-value of 2.272 × 10^-6 and an OR of 0.316 when utilizing the local ancestry allelic adjusted association model, while adjusting for Bantu-speaking African ancestry. However, this SNP was located in an intergenic region, making the link to TB susceptibility unclear.
title: Confirmation of HLA-II associations with TB susceptibility in admixed African samples

finding: pgBoost linked rs2295348, fine-mapped for mean corpuscular volume (PIP 0.58), to RNF24, located 210kb from the TSS. The SNP was situated in an ENCODE cCRE with a distal enhancer signature within the intron of CDC25B. Although the link had not yet been experimentally validated, RNF24 was considered biologically plausible due to its association with decreased erythrocyte numbers in knockout mice.
title: Linking regulatory variants to target genes by integrating single-cell multiome methods and genomic distance

finding: SNP rs2273500 was also a cis-eQTL for nicotinic receptor genes, reinforcing its role in addiction to nicotine.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: This SNP was found to affect MMP9 plasma protein levels specifically in STEMI patients (genotype β=-0.68, p=0.016), highlighting its role in the disease context.
title: Single-cell dissection of the immune response after acute myocardial infarction

finding: Found to be associated with mild progression subtype (Subtype I), hinting at genetic factors that may favor slower disease progression.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The rs1883832 SNP was identified in a GWAS that utilized an exome chip and implicated it within the Kozak sequence of the CD40 gene, which encodes a costimulatory receptor. This finding related to immune and inflammatory responses, making it a significant contributor to modified disease progression in muscular dystrophies.
title: Candidate gene modifiers of dystrophinopathy identified by the uniform application of genome-wide datasets to novel GWAS-identified loci

finding: The SNP rs143384 was shown to co-localize with the OA risk marker at the GDF5 locus. This association was notably present in the context of various primary phenotypes of OA such as All OA and Total Joint Replacement, with a posterior probability of 0.916. The risk allele G correlated with significantly lower DNA methylation at cg12548730, reinforcing its role as a genetic risk factor.
title: Epigenetic mechanisms of osteoarthritis risk in human skeletal development

finding: The SNP rs6062302 showed strong associations with glioblastoma at genome-wide significance (P = 1.00 x 10^-13). This finding contributed to confirming the role of RTEL1 as a risk factor for glioma.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs2297440 was linked to significant risks for glioblastoma and glioma, with P values of 4.00 x 10^-46 and 2.00 x 10^-42 respectively. Additionally, it was associated with immune system phenotypes such as dermatitis and Crohn's disease.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: The SNP rs6063202 was significantly associated with glioblastoma (P = 1.00 x 10^-13) as well as allergy-related traits, indicating a potential link between RTEL1 and glioma risk.
title: Multi-omics Mendelian randomisation using expression, splicing and protein quantitative trait loci: identification of novel drug targets for gliomagenesis

finding: This SNP was significantly associated (P < 0.05) with the STAU1 gene, exhibiting stronger association than noted in prior dyslexia studies.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association analysis of quantitative reading skill and dyslexia improves gene discovery

finding: The variant rs143384, which showed a higher frequency in Africans, is associated with FVC, lung function, and PEF, indicating its relevance to pulmonary function traits.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Pulmonary Function in Europeans and Africans from the UK Biobank Identifies Distinct Variants

finding: The study found that the SNP rs1883832 was strongly associated with the risk of multiple sclerosis (MS), as indicated by a highly significant p-value (p = 1.07 x 10^-281 in outcome GWAS). It was revealed that the causal association between plasma CD40 levels and MS risk was biased by this SNP. The GTEx project linked the C allele of rs1883832 to increased CD40 levels in both blood and cerebral cortex, suggesting its potential role in MS pathogenesis through the CD40–CD40L costimulatory pathway.
title: Circulating inflammatory proteins and risk of Parkinson’s disease and other neurodegenerative disorders: a two-sample Mendelian randomization study

finding: The SNP rs80339443 was identified as a genome-wide significant locus for CIDP risk among women in the study. It was located in the intron region of the gene CDH4, which encodes the retinal-cadherin protein involved in critical processes such as neuronal outgrowth and cell adhesion. The association was characterized by a significant odds ratio of 4.37 with a P-value of 1.49 × 10^-8, indicating a strong link between this variant and the risk of developing chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyneuropathy.
title: Genetic analyses of inflammatory polyneuropathy and chronic inflammatory demyelinating polyradiculoneuropathy identified candidate genes

finding: This SNP was linked to the PHF20 gene, showing an MTAG-CES association with a p-value of 6.62x10^-5, indicating a stronger association than previously noted (p-value=6.05x10^-4) in the MEGASTROKE-CES analysis.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: This SNP was linked to the KIAA1755 gene, which had not previously been associated with AF. The variant was characterized as a missense variant causing an R1045W change, predicted to be deleterious (SIFT score of 0.007) and had associations with other traits such as heart rate and PR interval.
title: MULTITRAIT ANALYSIS EXPANDS GENETIC RISK FACTORS IN CARDIOEMBOLIC STROKE

finding: The SNP rs13040909 was associated with the gene PFKFB3, which was found to be elevated in neutrophils from individuals with rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This SNP was linked to the regulation of neutrophil functions, particularly in relation to the production of reactive oxygen species (ROS) and neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs). As highlighted in related studies, alterations in PFKFB3 expression may influence inflammatory responses in RA, suggesting a genetic basis for the dysregulation of neutrophil activation during inflammatory conditions.
title: The small molecule inhibitor 3PO is a modulator of neutrophil metabolism, ROS production and NET release

finding: This SNP marked a significant locus at 20q11.21 for the BCL2L1 gene with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.798 and a p-value of 1.7×10^-56, significant in the context of recent admixture effects in AFR ancestry.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide association meta-analysis of mosaic loss of chromosome Y in the Million Veteran Program identifies 167 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs202380 in OCSTAMP was nominally significant (p=2.98×10^-7) based on the suggestive findings.
title: African Ancestry GWAS of Dementia in a Large Military Cohort Identifies Significant Risk Loci

finding: The coding variant rs1799990 (M129V) was previously associated with dramatic effects on prion disease risk, duration, age of onset, clinical presentation, and histopathology across many subtypes of sporadic, acquired, and genetic prion disease. Notably, the heterozygous genotype conferred strong protection against sporadic CJD, indicating a significant relationship (odds ratio of 0.39, p = 1e-135). This SNP was identified as the lead SNP for an eQTL for PRNP in several peripheral tissues.
title: PrP concentration in the central nervous system: regional variability, genotypic effects, and pharmacodynamic impact

finding: The SNP rs200986288 was identified as a novel variant associated with Alzheimer's disease, not previously reported in genetic association studies.
title: Linkage Disequilibrium-Informed Deep Learning Framework to Identify Genetic Loci for Alzheimer’s Disease Using Whole Genome Sequencing Data

finding: The SNP rs13039273, located at the 20q13.31 locus, was identified as UL risk-increasing associated with lower expression of RBM38 in the ovary (p=8.7×10<sup>−6</sup>) and uterus (eQTL p=2.2×10<sup>−3</sup>). This finding related to the regulation of CDKN1A mRNA stability, which is linked to cell cycle control and thus implicated in UL pathophysiology.
title: Evidence of a causal relationship between genetic tendency to gain muscle mass and uterine leiomyomata

finding: The SNP rs760640162 was previously associated with 'pregnancy examination and test' (p=5.97×10<sup>−15</sup>) in the UK Biobank. This association occurred at the 20q13.31 locus, suggesting a potential role in reproductive function, which connects to the broader context of UL risk factors.
title: Evidence of a causal relationship between genetic tendency to gain muscle mass and uterine leiomyomata

finding: The SNP rs58744877 near GNAS showed a negative association with FVC (P=2.71×10^-14, β=-0.033). No other prior associations were mentioned.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: This SNP was found within the KCNB1 gene and was included in a critical disease signature community, associated with exocytosis regulation and showing potential implications in insulin signaling among ME/CFS patients.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The non-synonymous variant rs16991615 in the MCM8 gene was identified as significantly associated with AMH levels at a p-value of 4.68 × 10^-9, corroborating previous findings regarding its connection to AMH levels in pre-menopausal women.
title: Circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women: novel genetic insights from a GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs16980973 was identified as associated with neck or shoulder pain in the male-specific GWAS, located in the SLC24A3 gene on chromosome 20 (p = 6.52 x 10^-9). This gene's function in calcium homeostasis suggested implications for pain regulation distinct in males.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The neighboring locus associated with SCZ1 (rs6088962 at 20q11.21) was found to have significant implications for schizophrenia. Like rs3068507, it also mapped to the MYLK2 gene.
title: Nine Neuroimaging-AI Endophenotypes Unravel Disease Heterogeneity and Partial Overlap across Four Brain Disorders: A Dimensional Neuroanatomical Representation

finding: This SNP was associated with 'transposition of great arteries'. The PheWAS using Peds-Phecodes demonstrated replication of the association with a relevant phenotype (Peds-Phecode 747.1113 'Transposition of great vessels').
title: Developing and Evaluating Pediatric Phecodes (Peds-Phecodes) for High-Throughput Phenotyping Using Electronic Health Records

finding: The study found that rs1884673 significantly impacted the causal inference of the level of CD33 on CD33<sup>dim</sup> HLA DR<sup>−</sup>, thereby influencing the outcomes related to mediation analyses.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The rs3918242 functional polymorphism of the MMP9 gene was found to be more common in individuals with bipolar disorder (BD) compared to healthy controls, with a statistically significant result (p=0.02). This finding suggested a potential association between the MMP9 genetic variant and the predisposition to BD.
title: The Blood-Brain Barrier in Bipolar Disorders: A Systematic Review

finding: The SLC52A3 locus (lead SNP rs6140149) was novelly associated with vitamin B2, highlighting its role in vitamin metabolism.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The SNP rs1883832 was associated with CD40 and showed strong evidence of colocalization across multiple tissues.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP rs6032259 was associated with Kunitz-type protease inhibitor 3 (SPIT3), significant exclusively in males, and the protein has been reported to be predominantly expressed in the epididymis, with unclear functions regarding male fertility.
title: Similar and different: systematic investigation of proteogenomic variation between sexes and its relevance for human diseases

finding: The SNP rs867186 was positively correlated with the risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) due to the presence of the minor G allele. Additionally, it showed a negative correlation with coronary artery disease (CAD), suggesting that this SNP had differing effects on venous and arterial conditions. This finding was supported by previous GWAS studies, which indicated the multifaceted role of the PROCR gene, where it was linked to CAD through anti-inflammatory mechanisms and to VTE via pro-thrombotic mechanisms.
title: Blood plasma proteome-wide association study implicates novel proteins in the pathogenesis of multiple cardiovascular diseases

finding: The SNP rs2284265 demonstrated an association with BMI, having a beta of 0.012 and a P value of 4.8 × 10^-8. It was reported within 500kb of HNF4A.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs12625671 was associated with T2D, with a reported beta of 0.067 and a P value of 1.7 × 10^-68, indicating a strong link with metabolic disease.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs143865354 on chromosome 20p11 reached genome-wide significance (p = 7.53×10^-9) in distinguishing risk for bilateral clefts (BCL) compared to unilateral clefts (UCL). This finding illustrates the genetic distinction in OFC subtypes and indicates potential implications in cleft severity.
title: The PAX1 locus at 20p11 is a modifier for bilateral cleft lip only

finding: The SNP rs72626599, positioned in the NKILA-MIR4532 intergenic region, was associated with gout with a meta-analysis P value of 6.48 × 10^-9 and an odds ratio of 1.58.
title: Novel genetic loci in adolescent-onset gout derived from whole genome sequencing of a Chinese cohort

finding: Identified as a SABR-specific sQTL for KIF16B, this variant had a p-value of 3.36e-28 and a beta coefficient of 2.03, being absent from 1000 Genomes Africans but present at 2.1% frequency in SABR.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: Novel variant rs17800010 of LINC02871 was identified, previously associated with bladder carcinoma and adolescent idiopathic scoliosis, now linked to lung cancer.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP near BTBD3 was significantly associated with lung cancer risk, particularly notable in Asian populations and also reported in connection with smoking behaviors.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The rare intergenic variant rs138934990 near CBLN4-LINC01441 was significantly associated with lung cancer risk across ethnicities.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: The ncRNA intronic variant near RTEL1 exhibited strong evidence for adenocarcinoma risk.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP was found near C20orf166-AS1 and showed associations with multiple microRNAs including miR-1 and miR-133a, suggesting its involvement in insulin signaling and the potential relevance of the miRNA-CpG axis in metabolic disorders.
title: The Molecular Human – A Roadmap of Molecular Interactions Linking Multiomics Networks with Disease Endpoints

finding: The rs6088765-G variant was observed to decrease the risk of NMSC (OR 0.95, 95% CI 0.91-0.99) and was found to be significant in both the discovery and validation cohorts.
title: Inflammatory Bowel Disease Risk Variants Are Associated with an Increased Risk of Skin Cancer

finding: The study revealed that rs1799990, which represents a single-nucleotide variant at codon 129 of the prion gene PRNP, was associated with an elevated risk of developing sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD). Individuals homozygous for this variant exhibited a shorter survival time compared to heterozygous individuals, highlighting its role as a strong determinant of clinical phenotype in prion disease cases.
title: Prion protein gene mutation detection using long-read Nanopore sequencing

finding: The SNP rs3746444 in the MIR499A gene was significantly associated with CHD. Using the co-dominant model, the association was strong [χ2 = 79.51; P = 0.0001]. In the dominant model, the odds ratio was 9.333 (5.180-16.82; P = 0.0001), indicating a substantial increase in risk. The heterozygous and additive models also showed significant findings with odds ratios of 0.1241 (0.065-0.234; P = 0.0001) and 0.3440 (0.2468-0.4795; P = 0.0001), respectively.
title: The potential impact of microRNA-related functional polymorphisms in the pathogenesis of coronary heart disease

finding: The rs137854543 variant was identified in a GALC mutation context within the PDAC cell line PK59, thereby underscoring its relevance in the study of lysosomal dysfunction and PDAC pathology.
title: Lysosomal Storage Dysfunction, a Germline Variants Affecting Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma Development and Progression

finding: The SNP rs6032660 stood out in the analysis for its involvement in genetic relationships between PTSD and cardiovascular diseases.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The variant was associated with the expression of <italic>CPNE1</italic> and several protein traits.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: The rs6127099 SNP, an intergenic variant around 50kb downstream of CYP24A1, was associated with an odds ratio of 11.42 for kidney stone disease risk due to a 1 standard deviation increase in serum calcium concentration.
title: Genetic variants predisposing to increased risk of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs143383 located in GDF5 was associated with hip axis length (HAL) with a P value of 9.4×10^−10. It was previously known to affect hip morphology and was found to be protective of osteoarthritis (OA) and hip osteoarthritis (HOA), indicating that decreased GDF5 expression is involved in the pathogenesis of osteoarthritis.
title: Genome-wide association study of DXA-derived hip morphology identifies associations with 4 loci in Chinese populations

finding: The SNP rs3787220 was identified as a synonymous variant in NCOA6, linked with cancer risks, showing an odds ratio (OR) range of 0.85 to 0.88 across cancer types.
title: Exome-wide association studies discover germline mutation patterns and identify high-risk populations in human cancers

finding: The variant rs16991615 was confirmed as a previously reported missense variant within the <italic>MCM8</italic> gene, showing a strong association with circulating AMH levels as well as implications for age at menopause.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis identifies three novel loci for circulating anti-Müllerian hormone levels in women

finding: The variant rs73078758 near SLX41P was discovered in the GWAS with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.29, indicating a potential risk associated with this DVT variant, although no specific replication details were provided.
title: Using genotyping and whole-exome sequencing data to improve genetic risk prediction in deep venous thrombosis

finding: The SNP rs6032676 on chromosome 20 was discovered in the male-only analysis as a genome-wide significant risk locus, showing a p-value of 9.55×10−9, indicating it was associated with genetic risk for borderline personality disorder (BPD) that was undetected in the main analysis.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The SNP rs2585447 was associated with brain enriched myelin associated protein (BCAS1), which exhibited significant splice variants in MS patient samples. BCAS1 was noted for its important role in early myelination, suggesting that this SNP could impact myelination processes in the context of MS.
title: Gene expression and alternative splicing analysis in a large-scale Multiple Sclerosis study

finding: The association of SNP rs2427238 at the locus 20q13.33 was found to be significantly related to the risk of developing orofacial clefts, marking it as an important genetic locus in this study.
title: Genome-wide association study of multiethnic non-syndromic orofacial cleft families identifies novel loci specific to family and phenotypic subtypes

finding: The SNP rs6059655 in the ASIP gene displayed a significantly increased effect on basal cell carcinoma (BCC) risk in SOTRs, with a 1.9-fold greater effect size (SOTR log (OR)=0.49 vs log (OR)=0.26 in non-transplant individuals).
title: Re-weighting MC1R, ASIP and IRF4 risk variants optimises polygenic risk scores for keratinocyte cancer stratification in solid organ transplant recipients

finding: The frame-shift mutation rs750318549 (p.Gly646fs) in ASXL1 showed a strong protective association with nicotine dependence (OR=2.41; CI=1.9-3.0; P=7.6e-15). This variant was pathogenic in germline scenarios, suggesting the association pertains to somatic mutations.
title: Rare coding variants in CHRNB2 reduce the likelihood of smoking

finding: SNP rs6047482 was associated with multiple traits identified by TraitScan, including alkaline phosphatase and IGF-1. EWS was shown to be linked causally to lower levels of alkaline phosphatase as suggested by the MR analysis.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: SNP rs6106336 was implicated similarly to rs6047482 in associations with traits identified by TraitScan. The genetic score for EWS SNPs was linked to traits significant in the analysis performed.
title: Subset scanning for multi-trait analysis using GWAS summary statistics

finding: Identified as having strong direct effects on AUD.
title: Genetic underpinnings of the transition from alcohol consumption to alcohol use disorder: shared and unique genetic architectures in a cross-ancestry sample

finding: This missense variant located in KIAA1755 was suggested to influence heart rate variability, indicating its potential impact on AF.
title: Trans-ancestry genome-wide analysis of atrial fibrillation provides new insights into disease biology and enables polygenic prediction of cardioembolic risk

finding: This previously identified SNP was associated with cardiovascular traits in the EUR cohort with strong significance (p=2.8×10^-80) and demonstrated relevance in the broader context of cardiovascular disease.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: Showed association related to traits impacting cardiovascular traits, consistently confirming its relevance.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: rs1015362 was identified as an enhancer SNP and was noted to map to an androgen receptor (AR) binding sequence, which is involved in carcinogenesis and tumour growth in prostate cancer. This intergenic SNP showed relevance to functional variants.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The SNP rs3746619, located in the 5' UTR of the <italic>MC3R</italic> gene, was associated with earlier age at menarche. Its function-increasing alleles were implicated in conferring a statistically significant interaction effect with the expression-increasing alleles of <italic>GPR83</italic>, indicating that an increase in <italic>MC3R</italic> function through <italic>GPR83</italic> expression led to earlier puberty timing.
title: Understanding the genetic complexity of puberty timing across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The SNP rs13040917 was associated with patient recurrence-free survival and castration resistance in prostate cancer (PCa) as reported in the study by Zhang et al. (2021). This finding underscored the potential of this SNP in providing insights into the genetic predisposition of patients to rapidly progress from hormone-sensitive prostate cancer (HSPC) to castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC).
title: Identifying patients with rapid progression from hormone-sensitive to castration-resistant prostate cancer: a retrospective study

finding: The rs2209313-T (duplication) allele was linked to an increased risk of developing Alzheimer Disease (AD) in patients with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) who were homozygous for the Dup allele, with an increased cerebrospinal fluid t-Tau/Aβ ratio. Longitudinal studies indicated that Dup/Dup patients exhibited a slower cognitive decline compared to wild-type patients, suggesting a protective effect associated with the duplication allele despite being a risk factor for conversion from MCI to AD.
title: An intragenic duplication within SIRPβ1 shows a dual effect over Alzheimer’s disease cognitive decline altering the microglial response

finding: The SNP rs1741294 was identified as a male-specific variant associated with CRF-slope; however, it showed no evidence of association in females or the combined sample.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The PRPF6 locus variant rs80150989 was identified as a novel susceptibility locus for lung cancer that colocalised with LTL. This association suggested that genetic variants involved in RNA binding and splicing could play a role in the carcinogenesis of lung cancer.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: The study identified the rs1274412848 variant, a homozygous transversion mutation causing a cysteine to serine alteration at position 148 of the PCNA protein (C148S), which was confirmed in all three patients with PCNA-Associated DNA Repair Disorder (PARD). This mutation was shown to have a low minor allele frequency in the general population and was predicted to be pathogenic, suggesting it as the underlying cause of disease in the identified patients.
title: PCNA thermosensitivity underlies an Ataxia Telangiectasia-like disorder

finding: The variant rs67351073 at 20q13 in ZGPAT was linked to a reduced risk of OC (OR: 0.78, 95% CI: 0.72, 0.85; p=4.45×10^-8).
title: Cross-ancestral GWAS identifies 29 novel variants across Head and Neck Cancer subsites

finding: As a sentinel SNP for MACROD2, this variant was previously associated with thyroid-associated orbitopathy, an immune-mediated eye disorder, underscoring its impact on retinal thickness.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: This SNP was part of the pixel-level analysis and showed significant associations indicating effects on retinal thickness, reinforcing connections with previously noted loci in retinal health.
title: Multi-omic spatial effects on high-resolution AI-derived retinal thickness

finding: SNP rs73274724 was an intergenic variant near SORCS3 and part of the novel associations identified with substance use disorders.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs8126001 located in the 5′ UTR of OPRL1 and upstream of RGS19 was previously associated with triglycerides (TGs), high-density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C), systolic blood pressure (SBP), waist circumference, and waist-to-hip ratio adjusted for BMI (WHRadjBMI) in the UK Biobank.
title: Identification of Genetic Loci Simultaneously Associated with Multiple Cardiometabolic Traits

finding: The rs6104690 SNP was significantly linked to bladder cancer, presenting a strong association in diverse studies, particularly in correlation with MICB risk.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs6108803 SNP was identified in relation to MICB risk and was considered significant in various studies focusing on bladder cancer.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The SNP rs1342740627 showed a significant association with left ventricular outflow tract obstruction (LVOTO broad) during the GWAS, with a beta value of 4.8 and P = 1.8×10^-8. This variant was also enriched in the Finnish population.
title: Genomic and transcriptomic data analyses highlight KPNB1 and MYL4 as novel risk genes for congenital heart disease

finding: The rs2618566 variant was identified as a chromatin accessibility quantitative trait locus (caQTL) in the HepG2 cell type and was shown to significantly influence chromatin accessibility when edited.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: The rs8126001 variant was shown to increase expression of the OPRL1 gene when edited from minor to major allele, correlating with decreased LDL-C uptake. It was also part of the identified caQTLs affecting chromatin accessibility.
title: Joint genotypic and phenotypic outcome modeling improves base editing variant effect quantification

finding: The SNP rs1883832 was identified in a haplotype within the <italic>CD40</italic> gene, which encodes a costimulatory receptor linked to immune responses. Although originally found in a smaller GWAS with no loci reaching statistical significance, this finding highlighted its potential role as a genetic modifier in DMD.
title: A genome-wide association analysis of loss of ambulation in dystrophinopathy patients suggests multiple candidate modifiers of disease severity

finding: At the PTPRT locus, the intronic variant rs185250851 exhibited rare associations with fasting insulin (FI), particularly noted for its absence in Asian populations.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The intergenic variant rs78618809 near PTPRT was found to have associations with fasting insulin (FI) and was noted for its proximity to regulatory regions.
title: Whole Genome Sequence Association Analysis of Fasting Glucose and Fasting Insulin Levels in Diverse Cohorts from the NHLBI TOPMed Program

finding: The SNP rs4810485 was found to explain over 80% of the posterior probability of colocalization between CD40 protein levels and genetic associations with all-stroke, ischemic-stroke, and large-artery-stroke.
title: Genetically predicted levels of the human plasma proteome and risk of stroke: a Mendelian Randomization study

finding: The variant rs1800961 was associated with the gene HNF4A and had a very significant association (P = 4.06×10^-16) with heart failure. Its exonic location raises its potential relevance in the genetic predisposition to the disease.
title: Exploring novel risk loci for heart failure and the shared genetic etiology with blood lipids, blood pressure, and blood glucose: a large-scale multi-trait association analysis

finding: The SNP rs680379 was associated with the ratio of SM(d34:1)/SM(d43:1) and reached genome-wide significance corrected for four metabolic traits, linking it to genes involved in sphingolipid metabolism and Alzheimer's biomarkers.
title: Multi-Omic Analyses Characterize the Ceramide/Sphingomyelin Pathway as a Therapeutic Target in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs168622 replicated an association with the SM ratio found previously in a larger population-based mGWAS, demonstrating a strong link to sphingolipid metabolism relevant to Alzheimer's disease, with high correlation to the lead SNP rs680379.
title: Multi-Omic Analyses Characterize the Ceramide/Sphingomyelin Pathway as a Therapeutic Target in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The rs6011779 variant was also confirmed to associate with lung cancer (LC) in the meta-analysis, contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors for LC.
title: Machine learning-based proteogenomic data modeling identifies circulating plasma biomarkers for early detection of lung cancer

finding: SNP rs74874116, found near the GATA5 gene, was reported to have a HR of 2.67 and a p-value of 1.47 x 10^-9, suggesting its potential role in converting from active surveillance among prostate cancer patients.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Prostate Cancer Conversion from Active Surveillance to Treatment

finding: The SNP rs7360523 on chromosome 20, in proximity to the gene SULF2, was identified as significantly associated with disease-specific mortality, particularly among patients suffering from heart failure. This finding was notable given that it was the only locus found to have a genome-wide significant association with disease-specific mortality across the ten diseases studied.
title: Limited overlap between genetic effects on disease susceptibility and disease survival

finding: The research by Kim et al. demonstrated that the SNP rs13040823 was predictive of effective adaptive therapy strategies for metastatic melanoma. The findings suggested that variations in this SNP could be used to tailor treatments based on mathematical models that predicted patient responses.
title: Feasibility of an Evolutionary Tumor Board for Generating Novel Personalized Therapeutic Strategies

finding: The SNP rs73106997, located in NCOA6, exhibited a notable association with Endoglin levels (p = 1.12 x 10^-7) and was associated with venous thrombosis according to the latest GWAS.
title: Non-canonical regulation of Endoglin by rare and common variants: new molecular and clinical perspectives for Hereditary Hemorrhagic Telangiectasia and beyond

finding: The SNP rs364585 was found to be significantly associated with the lipid species Cer(d19:1/22:0), with a P-value of 7.81×10<sup>-185</sup>. This association underscored its relevance in the study of lipid species and CAD.
title: Comprehensive genetic analysis of the human lipidome identifies novel loci controlling lipid homeostasis with links to coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs6065926 was identified as an LD buddy of schizophrenia COJO variants and was located within a microglial enhancer. This SNP was associated with the CD40 gene, which is crucial for immune response regulation, highlighting its link to schizophrenia.
title: Biological Insights from Schizophrenia-associated Loci in Ancestral Populations

finding: This SNP was associated with coffee and tea intake, linked through high linkage disequilibrium with another variant previously associated with bitter beverage consumption.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: The analysis of rs6017342, a genetic variant in the HNF4A locus, revealed that ileal ACE2 levels were significantly lower in patients who carried the HNF4A-AA genotype compared to those with the C-allele (HNF4A-AC or HNF4A-CC genotypes), with a p-value of 2.8E-02. This finding suggested a direct relationship between the HNF4A genotype and ACE2 expression specifically in the inflamed ileum. However, colonic ACE2 expression did not show any dependency on the HNF4A genotype, indicated by a p-value of 6.7E-01.
title: Intestinal receptor of SARS-CoV-2 in inflamed IBD tissue is downregulated by HNF4A in ileum and upregulated by interferon regulating factors in colon

finding: The SNP rs13040676 was associated with the transcription factor AP4 and its role in mediating cell fate decisions, including proliferation and apoptosis. This finding was originally identified in the context of mechanisms relevant to cancer, indicating a potential link between genetic variation and cell behavior in adverse conditions, such as Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI).
title: Deriving time-concordant event cascades from gene expression data: A case study for Drug-Induced Liver Injury (DILI)

finding: The frequency of the G allele in rs2070235 (MYBL2) in Amami-Oshima island (0.324) was significantly higher than in the Hondo cluster (0.185) with a p-value less than 0.001, though it was not significantly different from that in the Ryukyu cluster.
title: Genetic lineage of the Amami islanders inferred from classical genetic markers

finding: Selection was indicated on rs619865 in the ASIP gene, with s estimated to be approximately 0.10. This SNP is significantly associated with freckling.
title: An approximate full-likelihood method for inferring selection and allele frequency trajectories from DNA sequence data

finding: The SNP rs6074022 was found to have robust expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) effects on the CD40 gene in synovial fibroblasts (SFs), particularly under the influence of a mixture of 8 proinflammatory cytokines. This association indicated a significant context-dependent activation of CD40 expression linked to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) pathogenesis.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The SNP rs4810485 was associated with CD40 expression in SFs, with significant eQTL analyses demonstrating its impact specifically under conditions of inflammation. This relationship underscored the role of this locus in RA risk.
title: Parsing multiomics landscape of activated synovial fibroblasts highlights drug targets linked to genetic risk of rheumatoid arthritis

finding: The rs362584 SNP, associated with cognitive ability and synthesized in motor nerve endings, exhibited a significant synergistic interaction with rs1815739, forming a crucial part of the model in distinguishing gymnasts from non-athletic individuals.
title: Detection of epistasis between ACTN3 and SNAP-25 with an insight towards gymnastic aptitude identification

finding: The SNP rs73105013-T in the gene <italic>MAP1LC3A</italic> was found to be associated with an increased risk for wet age-related macular degeneration (AMD). This finding was identified in a cohort of Finnish patients and indicates the potential role of autophagy-related genes in the pathogenesis of AMD.
title: Transcriptomic changes predict metabolic alterations in LC3 associated phagocytosis in aged mice

finding: SNP rs6026398 was identified as the most significant SNP associated with changes in brain segregation via Louvain modularity, yielding a p-value of 0.000814, pointing towards its involvement in Alzheimer's disease progression, although not significantly contributing to its overall development.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Brain Connectivity Changes for Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The trans pQTL rs867186 showed strong evidence for a causal association with deep venous thrombosis (DVT) (P=1.27×10−10; colocalization probability>0.9), supporting its role in the disease pathway.
title: Phenome-wide Mendelian randomization mapping the influence of the plasma proteome on complex diseases

finding: This protective T allele located in the 5' UTR of the OPRL1 gene was associated with a reduced risk of sPTB (effect: 0.896; adjusted p-value 4.04×10⁻⁵). The variant showed signs of positive selection and was implicated in nociceptive signaling during delivery.
title: Accounting for diverse evolutionary forces reveals the mosaic nature of selection on genomic regions associated with human preterm birth

finding: Mapped to the DDX27 gene on chromosome 20, this missense SNP had a high CADD score of 31 and was predicted to be deleterious by SIFT and possibly damaging by PolyPhen, indicating significant potential implications for longevity.
title: Identification of 13 independent genetic loci associated with cognitive resilience in healthy aging in 330,097 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs6042259 was associated with EBV infection in gastric carcinoma, with a finding indicating its potential role in influencing the severity of the disease. This association was derived from studies that identified genetic variations affecting EBV latency and infection efficiency, ultimately affecting the pathogenesis of gastric carcinoma in the context of Epstein-Barr virus infection.
title: CTCF-mediated Genomic Effects of BART Region on Epstein-Barr Virus Chromatin 3D Structure in Gastric Carcinoma Cells

finding: The SNP rs5029909 was identified as a novel HOMA-B locus at the FOXA2 gene with a strong association reported (β(SE)=-0.044(0.0079), P=2.70×10^-08) and was found to overlap with an established fasting glucose association (rs6113722, R²=0.69 in Europeans).
title: Genetics of fasting indices of glucose homeostasis using GWIS unravels tight relationships with inflammatory markers

finding: The SNP rs1047383 was identified as being associated with drug dependence, particularly in a subgroup of cocaine addicted patients, and this finding was replicated in an independent clinical sample. Additionally, this SNP was found nominally associated with illegal substance and cocaine addiction through two GWAS conducted on European-American samples. These findings suggested a significant link between rs1047383 and cocaine addiction.
title: Reduced cue-induced reinstatement of cocaine seeking behavior in Plcb1+/- mice

finding: This variant, located in the intron of DOK5, showed a significant association with waist circumference and waist-to-hip ratio. Its frequency was low (∼4%) in African populations, marking it as a unique variant for individuals with African ancestry, including those in the Malagasy cohort.
title: Whole-genome Studies of Malagasy People Uncover Novel Body Composition Associations

finding: The SNP rs143384 was significantly associated with chronic knee pain and was identified as a key locus in understanding genetic predisposition to knee-related pain.
title: Analysis of genetically independent phenotypes identifies shared genetic factors associated with chronic musculoskeletal pain at different anatomic sites

finding: This SNP was linked to PTPRT, which regulates signaling proteins involved in oncogenic transformations.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs285206 related to MYBL2, an important regulator in cell cycle and survival, was overexpressed in multiple cancers.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: This SNP involved with PLCB1, which plays a role in AML progression and is considered a potential therapeutic target.
title: Iterative feature selection method to discover predictive variables and interactions for high-dimensional transplant genomic data

finding: The SNP rs13040795 was identified in a study that examined the connection between the ATR-CHK11-WEE1 axis and cell-cycle regulation. This finding was significant as it related to the expression of <italic>Wee1</italic>, a critical negative-regulator of the G2/M transition in cell-cycle, which played an essential role in maintaining the cytoarchitecture of diapaused avian embryos during temperature fluctuations.
title: HREM, RNAseq and cell-cycle analyses reveal the role of the G2/M-regulatory protein, Wee1, on the survivability of chicken embryos during diapause

finding: The SNP rs228836 was one of the loci that achieved genome-wide significance in both UKB and the previous GWAS for sitting height ratio (SHR), affirming its impact on this trait.
title: Genetics of skeletal proportions in two different populations

finding: The SNP rs6042049 was associated with the regulation of the MYB transcription factor. This was notably highlighted in the context of differentiation, cell cycle control, and oncogenesis, as discussed in the publication by George and Ness in 2014. The finding suggested that variations at this SNP could influence MYB activity, which in turn could affect cancer development.
title: Rapid-kinetics degron benchmarking reveals off-target activities and mixed agonism-antagonism of MYB inhibitors

finding: The mutation altered the binding motif for SFRS9, resulting in a different interaction with the lncRNA sequence.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The SNP rs6065904, associated with the gene PLTP, displayed positive associations with small high-density lipoprotein particles (S-HDL-P) and M-HDL-P, but negative associations with L-HDL-P, XL-HDL-P, HDL-D, and smaller negative associations with ApoA1 and HDL-C, in addition to being negatively associated with CAD.
title: A Mendelian randomization study of the role of lipoprotein subfractions in coronary artery disease

finding: This SNP was linked to PROC protein through trans-regulatory mechanisms and was also associated with cardiovascular diseases.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: SNP rs867186 was known to be associated with coronary heart disease and was in strong LD with rs141091409, underscoring its relevance in cardiovascular risk.
title: A Bayesian joint pQTL study sheds light on the genetic architecture of obesity

finding: The intronic SNP rs11087622 in the SMOX gene was linked to variability in spermine levels, suggesting a genetic influence on this metabolic component.
title: Genome-wide metabolite quantitative trait loci analysis (mQTL) in red blood cells from volunteer blood donors

finding: The SNP rs13040698 was associated with enhanced tumorigenic and invasive potential in pancreatic cancer cells. This finding related to the context of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) and indicated that cells with this SNP exhibited characteristics that contributed to the aggressiveness of the disease.
title: ALK signaling drives tumorigenicity and chemoresistance of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells

finding: The study provided experimental validation for the rs185545661 SNP, which caused a proline-to-threonine change at position 306 in the SPO11 protein. This finding indicated that the variant negatively impacted oogenesis and spermatogenesis in mice, leading to reduced sperm and oocyte counts, chromosomal synapsis defects, and increased aneuploid gametes. This was significant as it hinted at possible implications for human infertility, including conditions like premature ovarian failure and reduced sperm counts.
title: A segregating human allele of SPO11 modeled in mice disrupts timing and amounts of meiotic recombination, causing oligospermia and a decreased ovarian reserve

finding: The SNP rs867186-GG genotype was associated with increased soluble endothelial protein C receptor (EPCR), which appeared to mediate protection against severe malaria. This finding suggested that genetic variations in EPCR could influence susceptibility to malaria-associated conditions, including severe outcomes like ARDS.
title: Endothelial Protein C Receptor Contributes to Experimental Malaria-Associated Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome

finding: Associated with greater SA in temporal regions for BD, this SNP showcased its genetic involvement in brain shape.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: Linked to increased SA in BD, rs2143943 reflects genetic influences connecting psychiatry and morphology.
title: The overlapping genetic architecture of psychiatric disorders and cortical brain structure

finding: The SNP rs13040707 was positively identified in the context of the study discussing the use of vault nanoparticles for gene therapy. These nanoparticles, noted for their role in drug delivery, were linked to physiological and pathological phenomena, suggesting a significant impact on treatments that leverage such nanovectors. The paper indicated innovative approaches by packaging AAV inside vault particles which could alter gene therapy administration, particularly regarding the neutralizing antibody challenges associated with AAV delivery.
title: Encapsulation of AAVs into protein vault nanoparticles as a novel solution to gene therapy’s neutralizing antibody problem

finding: The presence of the risk allele at rs6087990 was associated with reduced NFKB1 target gene expression in the non-inflamed context of Clusters 1 and 4, while it correlated with higher expression in Cluster 2. This demonstrates its potential role in modulating gene expression depending on the patient cohort cluster.
title: A systems genomics approach to uncover patient-specific pathogenic pathways and proteins in a complex disease

finding: The SNP rs6078373 was identified as part of a potential synthetic association related to smoking behavior in the EAS population. It was shown to be intergenic but strongly correlated (r² > 0.8) with a combination of two SNPs located within the BTBD3 gene, indicating a possible influence on the phenotype through these correlations.
title: On the contribution of genetic heterogeneity to complex traits

finding: A significant association was found with rs235710 in the 5' region of BMP2, with a p-value of 0.029. This SNP was linked to mandible volume in children with varying levels of prenatal alcohol exposure (PAE), suggesting a potential role in jaw development affected by ethanol.
title: Mutation in the Bone Morphogenetic Protein signaling pathway sensitize zebrafish and human to ethanol-induced jaw malformations

finding: The study highlighted that CpG methylation influenced the allelic expression of the GDF5 gene by affecting the binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins. This finding was previously established in the context of osteoarthritis (OA) susceptibility, linking the SNP rs143383 to OA pathology.
title: An evolutionary perspective of DNA methylation patterns in skeletal tissues using a nonhuman primate model of osteoarthritis

finding: Identified as a caQTL specific to classical monocytes, rs747748 showed significant effects as a caQTL active across multiple cell types.
title: Mapping genetic effects on cell type-specific chromatin accessibility and annotating complex trait variants using single nucleus ATAC-seq

finding: The SNP rs13040795 was associated with the functional interaction of the atr–chk1–wee1 axis in cancer. Inhibition of related pathways in colon cancer cells showed potential for therapeutic engagement, particularly in addressing the balance between oncogenic signaling and stress responses. The findings indicated that targeting this axis could enhance the effectiveness of cancer treatment strategies, contributing to tumor suppression in patient-derived models.
title: Paradoxical activation of oncogenic signaling as a cancer treatment strategy

finding: This SNP modified hip and knee morphology in humans, predisposing individuals to joint disease, and a similar effect was observed in single base pair replacement mice.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: This SNP was located within a highly conserved enhancer element (designated R4) of the Growth Differentiation Factor Five (GDF5) gene. The T allele associated with shorter height significantly affected GDF5 expression and decreased functional binding of the transcription factor PITX1 in mice.
title: Parallel evolution at the regulatory base-pair level contributes to mammalian inter-specific differences in polygenic traits

finding: The SNP rs680379 in the SPTLC3 gene associated significantly with several ceramide species such as CER[N(24)S(19)] and others at GWAS significance (P=4.82×10^-27). Genotype AA at rs680379 correlated to a 48% increase in CER[N(24)S(19)] concentration compared to GG genotypes, indicating its influential role in ceramide biosynthesis.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The SNP rs438568 within the SPTLC3 locus was associated with the ceramide species CER[N(22)S(19)] in GWAS analyses, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors in ceramide production.
title: Heritability and family-based GWAS analyses of the N-acyl ethanolamine and ceramide lipidome reveal genetic influence over circulating lipids

finding: The SNP rs62208470, located at the non-MHC locus ZHX3, exhibited chromatin accessibility at the corresponding mouse loci in microglia (MiGl) and oligodendrocytes (OLG) in both EAE and CFA-Ctr. Moreover, it overlapped with chromatin accessibility in human oligodendrocyte precursor cells (OPCs) in a non-disease context, suggesting a significant role in MS susceptibility.
title: A primed immune transcriptional program is activated in oligodendroglia in multiple sclerosis

finding: This SNP showed different associations, with significant results in ER analyses (P=4.3×10^-3) while presenting opposite effects in luminal A-like and triple-negative subtypes, showcasing the heterogeneity of genetic risk factors.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: The SNP rs6098088 was identified in a study measuring the onset of the growing season on Svalbard using MODIS-NDVI satellite data. This finding was significant in understanding the spatial and temporal variability of plant phenology in response to climate conditions, which relates to the observed phenological delay and subsequent compensatory growth in Arctic vegetation due to winter warming and icing effects.
title: Towards rainy Arctic winters: experimental icing impacts tundra plant productivity and reproduction

finding: The tag SNP rs747759 was associated with neuroticism and was linked to the CD40 gene, which played a significant role in dendrite growth. CD40 expression was found to be significantly higher in humans compared to macaques, and a potential loss of NHLH1 binding or a gain of NFYA binding sites at the human allele T was suggested.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The SNP rs1535043 was identified as being in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs747759 and potentially gained an EHF binding site at the human allele T. The implications of this SNP in relation to central nervous system traits remained unclear, but it contributed to an overall understanding of gene regulatory changes.
title: De novo human brain enhancers created by single nucleotide mutations

finding: The SNP rs13040896 was identified in the context of T1DM research, where pharmacological activation of the nuclear receptor LRH-1 (NR5A2) showed the potential to reverse hyperglycemia. This SNP was linked to the reprogramming of immune responses in T1DM, leading to reduced cytotoxic T-cell proliferation and improved islet function after xenotransplantation in mouse models. The findings indicated that this SNP may play a role in modulating immune tolerance and function in the context of T1DM.
title: LRH-1/NR5A2 Activation in Immune Cells from Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus Mitigates Inflammation via Immunometabolic Reprogramming and Enhanced Human Islet Function in Mice

finding: The analysis highlighted that the SNP rs143383 was associated with allelic expression of GDF5, which is influenced by CpG methylation changes. This relationship was established through the modulation of binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins, indicating that the methylation status at this SNP could play a significant role in the predisposition to osteoarthritis.
title: DNA hypomethylation during MSC chondrogenesis occurs predominantly at enhancer regions

finding: At the CASS4 locus, rs6064392 was validated as a causal variant through MPRA (p = 1.04 × 10⁻²²) and CRISPR in microglia (p = 4.2 × 10⁻²). Both SuSiE and CIT-Lasso pinpointed this causal variant correctly.
title: Beyond guilty by association at scale: searching for causal variants on the basis of genome-wide summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs4810485 was found to overlap with the ISGF3 regulon and was associated with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), Crohn's disease (CD), and ulcerative colitis (UC). This SNP is located in the intron of the CD40 gene, which plays a role in the activation of T-cells through interactions with CD40 ligand. Previous studies linked this SNP to CD40 as an expression, protein, and splice quantitative trait locus (e-, p-, sQTL) in blood and monocyte-specific datasets.
