title: Scalable ultra-high-throughput single-cell chromatin and RNA sequencing reveals gene regulatory dynamics linking macrophage polarization to autoimmune disease

finding: The SNP rs3092057 was previously identified in research conducted by Schulp and Alkemade in 2011, where it was linked to the efficiency of pollination as influenced by land cover mapping. The finding related to how uncertainty in land cover maps could affect mapping ecosystem functions, thereby highlighting the importance of the SNP in ecological studies.
title: A guide to between-community functional dissimilarity measures

finding: The study by Reynard et al. (2014) indicated that the SNP rs143383, associated with osteoarthritis susceptibility, had CpG methylation that influenced allelic expression of GDF5. This finding suggested that specific DNA methylation patterns could modulate the binding of repressor proteins SP1 and SP3, leading to implications for understanding genetic risk factors in osteoarthritis.
title: Intra- and Inter-Specific Investigations of Skeletal DNA Methylation and Femur Morphology in Primates

finding: The SNP rs6062304 was significantly associated with lymphocyte percentage and was assigned to the LIME1 gene through both TWAS and coloc methods. The predicted expression of LIME1 was highly correlated with rs6062304, reinforcing its role in T cell signaling and providing concordance between TWAS and coloc approaches.
title: Transcriptome-wide association study in UK Biobank Europeans identifies associations with blood cell traits

finding: The minor allele G of SNP rs13045408 at BTBD3-LINC01722 positively correlated with Bacteroides abundance (β = 0.043; P = 5.3 × 10-3) and negatively correlated with Prevotella abundance (β = -1.76; P = 1.6 × 10-4). This SNP was part of the top two loci explaining variance in the Bacteroides-Prevotella enterotype.
title: M-GWAS for the gut microbiome in Chinese adults illuminates on complex diseases

finding: Higher allele dosage of G in SNP rs12481710 showed a positive correlation between proximal tubule (PT) cell fractions and SYCP2 expression in kidney samples, indicating a cell-type specific genotype-gene expression interaction.
title: Mapping the genetic architecture of human traits to cell types in the kidney identifies mechanisms of disease and potential treatments

finding: This SNP was associated with ADHD, ASD, and OCD, showing a strong probability of association (p = 4.18 x 10^-10) and high m-values for ADHD and ASD (both m = 1), indicating a likely shared genetic influence among these disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: This SNP demonstrated significant association across ADHD, ASD, and OCD (p = 8.12 x 10^-9), with m-values suggesting a strong effect in all but Tourette Syndrome, indicating possible pleiotropic effects.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: Associated with ADHD, ASD, and OCD with a p-value of 2.90 x 10^-8 and high m-values for ADHD and ASD (both m > 0.9), supporting its role in multiple disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: This SNP was highlighted in the ASD individual GWAS and also significant among eight psychiatric disorders in a cross-disorder analysis, with a p-value of 2.72 x 10^-10, affirming its relevance in these disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: Top significant SNP in the analysis between ASD and TS (p = 1.79 x 10^-9, m = 1 for ASD), suggesting its involvement in the genetic overlap between these two disorders.
title: Cross-disorder GWAS meta-analysis for Attention Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder, Autism Spectrum Disorder, Obsessive Compulsive Disorder, and Tourette Syndrome

finding: The SNP rs13040731 was associated with ARID2 mutations in melanoma patients. This finding indicated that individuals carrying this SNP exhibited a disrupted PBAF complex, which in turn compromised the binding and inactivation of neuronal gene targets by the transcription factor REST, leading to upregulation of synaptic transcripts.
title: The SWI/SNF PBAF complex facilitates REST occupancy at repressive chromatin

finding: The SNP rs13040909 was linked to variations in the expression of PFKFB3 and PFKFB4, which were identified as significant contributors to cancer development and progression. The context of this finding emphasized the role of these genes as potential therapeutic targets, thereby establishing their relevance in the metabolic reprogramming associated with cancer.
title: Gradients in cellular metabolism regulate development of tonotopy along the cochlea

finding: The SNP rs200294064 was identified as a pathogenic candidate driver mutation within the TGM3 gene, which has been previously studied as a candidate driver in carcinomas of the head and neck. This finding contributed to the understanding of driver mutations in nasopharyngeal cancer.
title: Ontology-based prediction of cancer driver genes

finding: The SNP rs13040801 was linked to AKT3 expression in mesenchymal colorectal cancer cells, suggesting it drove cell growth and was connected to processes like epithelial-mesenchymal transition.
title: Down-regulation of AKT proteins slows the growth of mutant-KRAS pancreatic tumors

finding: The MMP-9 rs17576 polymorphism was associated with susceptibility to type 2 diabetes, suggesting its involvement in diabetic pathology.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2425019, located 4.5kb downstream of highly variable CAG and GGC repeats in the MMP24 gene, was reported to be associated with height. This association established a potential functional link between MMP24's polymorphic repeats and phenotypic traits like height.
title: Genome-wide survey of tandem repeats by nanopore sequencing shows that disease-associated repeats are more polymorphic in the general population

finding: The SNP rs6031431 was associated with enhancers in rapamycin-treated human coronary artery smooth muscle cells (CASMC). It was linked to cardiovascular-associated traits identified through genome-wide association studies (GWAS). This SNP was noted to be located in the enhancer region of the JPH2 gene, highlighting its relevance in the context of cardiac function and potential cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: Epigenetic Remodeling in Human Coronary Artery Smooth Muscle Cell Phenotypic Switching

finding: The study referenced the work of König et al. (2021) which detailed the impact of various actionable oncogenic driver alterations, including those that could correlate with SNP rs13040804. This SNP was considered significant in the context of targeted therapy for advanced NSCLC, highlighting its role in patient treatment outcomes.
title: Multiplexed electrokinetic sensor for detection and therapy monitoring of extracellular vesicles from liquid biopsies of non-small-cell lung cancer patients

finding: Stiller et al. (2021) discussed the detection of tumor-associated membrane receptors in NSCLC patients, implicating that SNP rs13040922 could be involved in the expression of these receptors on extracellular vesicles. The finding posited that genetic alterations at this locus may affect tumor interactions and therapeutic responses.
title: Multiplexed electrokinetic sensor for detection and therapy monitoring of extracellular vesicles from liquid biopsies of non-small-cell lung cancer patients

finding: The SNP rs6059655, located in the ASIP gene, showed significant enrichment in individuals with red hair who had only one MC1R variant. Specifically, 55% of these individuals carried the ASIP eQTL risk allele, compared to 31% of total individuals with red hair. This was a noteworthy finding, suggesting a possible role of ASIP in the pigmentation phenotype of red-haired individuals with varying MC1R alleles.
title: Expanded Analysis of Pigmentation Genetics in UK Biobank

finding: The variant rs363009 was present in HD patient cells and targeted for editing with AiEvo2. The engineered protein exhibited high editing efficiency for the mutant allele, demonstrating the utility of AiEvo2 for precise gene editing pertaining to Huntington's disease within a clinical context.
title: Discovery and engineering of AiEvo2, a novel Cas12a nuclease for human gene editing applications

finding: Associated with gamma glutamyltransferase levels, this SNP illustrates significant implications for metabolic conditions.
title: The impact of evolutionary processes in shaping the genetics of complex traits in East Asia and Europe: a specific contribution from Denisovan and Neanderthal introgression

finding: This SNP was associated with colorectal cancer in LD with significant GWAS peak SNPs; its disruption of CCNT2 motifs highlighted its functional relevance.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs1028396 was associated with a weaker response of SIRPA to SARS-CoV-2 in CD14+ monocytes, primarily observed in East Asians since it was characterized by significant historical selection events.
title: Environmental and genetic drivers of population differences in SARS-CoV-2 immune responses

finding: The SNP rs13040823 was included in research predicting adaptive therapy strategies for metastatic melanoma, illustrating the importance of mathematical modeling in understanding treatment efficacy and resistance as noted by Kim et al. (2021). This research provided insights into the potential for optimizing therapeutic approaches.
title: Dynamical modelling of proliferative-invasive plasticity and IFNγ signaling in melanoma reveals mechanisms of PD-L1 expression heterogeneity

finding: This variant was significantly associated with beat synchronization and located within human-accelerated regions (HARs). Although it was considered an eQTL regulating GBE1 expression, its direct link to beat synchronization was complex due to its role across various functions.
title: Genome-wide association study of musical beat synchronization demonstrates high polygenicity

finding: The rs6062129 variant within the MTG2 gene was associated with changes in time trial measures. MTG2 plays a role in mitochondrial ribosome assembly, and dysregulation could lead to decreased exercise response.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The rs6121949 variant, also in the MTG2 gene, showed a similar association as rs6062129. Both variants were moderately correlated and involved in mitochondrial function, influencing exercise outcomes.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: Upstream of MMP9 gene, this SNP was associated with EHR-OSA in Geisinger (beta=0.07, p=2.65x10^-2).
title: Characterization of Genetic and Phenotypic Heterogeneity of Obstructive Sleep Apnea Using Electronic Health Records

finding: Associated with adenoma count, this SNP's identification confirmed previous findings relating it to colorectal cancer risk.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP’s association with adenoma count further supported the link to colorectal cancer risk, as elucidated by varying studies.
title: Ability of known colorectal cancer susceptibility SNPs to predict colorectal cancer risk: A cohort study within the UK Biobank

finding: The finding associated with rs6062490 indicated differential transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) in haplotype blocks linked to atopic dermatitis. The AD patient in the study was homozygous for the risk haplotype, which was connected to increased expression of genes RTEL1 and TNFRSF6B, important for T cell biology.
title: maxATAC: genome-scale transcription-factor binding prediction from ATAC-seq with deep neural networks

finding: For rs1151624, the study reported differential TFBS associated with the risk haplotype linked to altered gene expression. Specifically, a trend for increased expression of SLC2A4RG and decreased expression of ZGPAT was noted in AD patients carrying the risk variant, suggesting a role in T cell function.
title: maxATAC: genome-scale transcription-factor binding prediction from ATAC-seq with deep neural networks

finding: The F31I substitution in aurora kinase A had a higher allele frequency of 67% in East Asian populations and was linked to an increased risk of developing colon cancer within these populations.
title: Peptide Ancestry Informative Markers in Uterine Neoplasms from Women of European, African and Asian Ancestry

finding: The SNP rs143383 was associated with osteoarthritis (OA) susceptibility. It was found that CpG methylation regulates the allelic expression of GDF5 by modulating the binding of SP1 and SP3 repressor proteins, implicating this SNP in the genetic predisposition to OA.
title: Engineered cartilage from human chondrocytes with homozygous knockout of cell cycle inhibitor p21

finding: The variant rs1884302 was associated with craniosynostosis in a prior GWAS, and it was found to account for almost all the observed phenotypic variation in a study related to digenic inheritance. Specifically, eleven of thirteen carriers of the damaging SMAD6 mutations were also carriers of rs1884302, indicating a strong interaction between these genetic factors. The statistical analysis provided strong evidence (p = 1.58×10⁻⁶, OR = 30.95) that supports the role of both SMAD6 and rs1884302 in contributing to craniosynostosis.
title: A genome-wide case-only test for the detection of digenic inheritance in human exomes

finding: The SNP rs13040883 was linked to a significant finding relating to the regulation of cell growth and proliferation, especially in the context of the study on the Tribbles pseudokinase conducted in *Drosophila*. This finding detailed the role of the JNK/MAPK and JAK/STAT signaling pathways in coordinating cellular responses during wound healing and tumor growth.
title: Shared enhancer gene regulatory networks between wound and oncogenic programs

finding: This SNP was replicated in the largest BMI meta GWAS, showing a significant association with a p-value of 3.3e-11.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: This SNP was associated with the gene VSX1, which has been replicated in the largest BMI meta-GWAS (p=5.8e-13), linking it to obesity.
title: Quantitative Genetic Scoring, or how to put a number on an arbitrary genetic region

finding: The allele rs115662534(T) disrupted the binding of transcription factors STAT1 to the regulatory elements of the human CD40 gene, positioning it as a potential marker of autoimmune diseases.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: The allele rs548231435(C) disrupted the binding of transcription factors EBF1 to the regulatory elements of the human CD40 gene, further associating it with autoimmune disease markers.
title: Landscape of allele-specific transcription factor binding in the human genome

finding: At this SNP, allelic imbalance was associated with total insulin content. The T2D risk allele 'C' was linked to specific transcription factor binding site motifs, but no direct association with RALY expression was found.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: Though this SNP was examined, the specific associations or mechanisms were not thoroughly detailed in the provided data. It was included in context concerning total insulin content.
title: Functional interrogation of twenty type 2 diabetes-associated genes using isogenic hESC-derived β-like cells

finding: The SNP rs13040843 was associated with the regulation of the mitochondrial protein LONP1. In the context of acute myeloid leukemia (AML), mutations in genes such as FBXO11 were implicated in reduced mitochondrial respiration, promoting myeloid-biased stem cell properties. FBXO11 was notably downregulated in AML, leading to enhanced mitochondrial respiration due to its role in K63-linked ubiquitination of LONP1. This relationship suggested that variations in the LONP1 regulatory pathway, which could include the SNP rs13040843, played a significant role in the disease mechanisms of AML.
title: Loss of FBXO11 function establishes a stem cell program in acute myeloid leukemia through dysregulation of mitochondrial LONP1

finding: The SNP rs2031717 related to the metabolism of fluorouracil (5-FU) in cancer was identified as having a significant positive finding. In the context of this study, it was shown that the metabolism and bioavailability of 5-FU were notably altered when used in conjunction with Schisandrin B (Sch-B), which modulated the effectiveness and accumulation of 5-FU metabolites in tumor tissue, enhancing its therapeutic potential.
title: Bioavailability of Schisandrin B and its effect on 5-Fluorouracil metabolism in a xenograft mouse model of colorectal cancer

finding: The SNP rs115855396 was associated with diabetes, with a suggestive p-value of 6.19 x 10^-6 in the NHLBI Family Heart Study. This finding highlighted the potential relevance of the NFIA gene region in diabetes when analyzing individuals taking medication for diabetes or glucose.
title: NFIA regulates granule recruitment and exocytosis in the adult pancreas

finding: The intronic variant rs144434404, residing within the BMP7 gene, showed significant association with microalbuminuria (OR = 6.75, P = 2.67×10^-9), underscoring BMP7’s role in renal morphogenesis and its relevance in diabetic kidney disease.
title: Genome-wide association study of diabetic kidney disease highlights biology involved in renal basement membrane collagen

finding: The rs6073958 variant was significantly associated with lower levels of the percentage of free cholesterol in small HDL (S_HDL_FC_pct) in the control group, showing a beta of -0.146 and a p-value less than 1e-300. In contrast, it did not show a significant association in the T2D patients’ group (beta = -0.002, p = 0.93). This indicates that the genetic regulation of S_HDL_FC_pct was attenuated in T2D patients relative to controls, suggesting a consequence of T2D rather than a causal factor.
title: Insights into the metabolic consequences of type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6021275 was positively associated with the effectiveness of satellite-derived burned area products in analyzing forest fire dynamics. Specifically, it was highlighted in a study by Tsela et al. (2014) that validated MODIS satellite burned-area products, indicating its role in accurately reflecting the spatial and temporal patterns of forest fires and burned areas, which was pivotal in understanding fire regime characteristics.
title: Spatio-temporal patterns of wildfires in the Niassa Reserve –Mozambique, using remote sensing data

finding: The SNP rs151176846 was significantly associated with ND as an intronic SNP in CHRNA4. This SNP was previously reported to have associations with various smoking traits in earlier studies.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: The SNP rs2259735 served as an instrument in Mendelian Randomization analysis, indicating a positive association with elevated expression of CYP24A1 leading to increased multiple sclerosis (MS) risk.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs2248137, a known MS association, was involved in an interaction that increased CYP24A1 expression with higher neuronal proportions, indicating a strong relationship with MS.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs6086929 was identified as a positive finding related to the study of ecological data and remote sensing, specifically in the context of NDVI (Normalized Difference Vegetation Index) trends from the AVHRR satellite data over the period from 1981 to 2012, as discussed by Pinzon & Tucker in their 2014 publication.
title: The Portal Project: a long-term study of a Chihuahuan desert ecosystem

finding: This SNP exhibited the strongest selection signal in East Asian populations (EAS) and was associated with blood protein levels, significantly contributing to the understanding of immune-related traits.
title: Improved detection of evolutionary selection highlights potential bias from different sequencing strategies in complex genomic-regions

finding: SIA reported a moderate signal of selection at the ASIP locus, with a selection probability of 0.78 and a selection coefficient around 0.0019, which is relevant to pigmentation.
title: SIA: Selection Inference Using the Ancestral Recombination Graph

finding: SNP rs1800961 was replaced by rs7499892 when a debiasing step was added to the analysis, both having similar effect sizes for the HDL phenotype.
title: Iterative Hard Thresholding in GWAS: Generalized Linear Models, Prior Weights, and Double Sparsity

finding: The SNP rs6013892 was implicated in the regulation of CYP24A1, where it was confirmed to have a causal effect on altering regulatory activities through luciferase reporter assay, showing reduced transcription when variants were swapped.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: SNP rs158523, closely related to rs6013892, also significantly affected the regulatory activity of CYP24A1, with its major haplotype exhibiting the strongest transcriptional activity.
title: Drug-induced cis-regulatory elements in human hepatocytes affect molecular phenotypes associated with adverse reactions

finding: The SNP rs143383 was identified as being involved in the susceptibility to osteoarthritis (OA) through its regulation of GDF5 expression. This finding was based on the observation that CpG methylation influenced allelic expression of GDF5 by altering the binding of repressor proteins SP1 and SP3. This molecular mechanism revealed an essential pathway linking genetic predisposition to the disease's pathophysiology, indicating that rs143383 plays a critical role in OA progression.
title: Modelling Osteoarthritis pathogenesis through Mechanical Loading in an Osteochondral Unit-on-Chip

finding: The SNP rs6117669 was found within the enhancer +421BMP2, which showed prominent activity in cranial cartilage. This enhancer's activity indicated its potential role in contributing to craniosynostosis risk as it directed significant gene expression in developing skeletal tissues.
title: Identification of conserved skeletal enhancers associated with craniosynostosis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs11699612 within the CASC20 locus was identified as a susceptibility locus for HO and achieved genome-wide significance upon replication with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.90 (95% CI 1.34-2.68) and a p-value of 2.70×10−5. This finding highlighted the role of CASC20, a human-specific long non-coding RNA, in the context of HO.
title: Genome-wide association and functional analyses identify CASC20 and KIF26B as target loci in heterotopic ossification

finding: The study reaffirmed previous findings that the genetic variant rs1042580 in THBD was associated with risk for ICU admission and mortality from COVID-19, indicating potential implications for progression due to its location in the 3' UTR influencing gene expression regulatory mechanisms.
title: Multi-omic Profiling Reveals Early Immunological Indicators for Identifying COVID-19 Progressors

finding: The SNP rs6119471, associated with the ASIP gene, showed a large selection difference between Eurasians and Africans. The derived allele was almost fixed in Eurasians but maintained a low frequency in Africans. Recent studies suggested this SNP could predict dark/non-dark pigmentation phenotypes in humans.
title: Dissecting dynamics and differences of selective pressures in the evolution of human pigmentation

finding: This variant was part of three replicated significant interactions for skin color, thereby suggesting its role in genetic interactions that affect pigmentation traits.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Part of significant epistatic interactions for skin color, indicating its role alongside other variants in the network influencing pigmentation.
title: Dispensing with unnecessary assumptions in population genetics analysis

finding: Noted as another joint lead risk SNP for vitiligo and melanoma, supporting the notion of shared genetic architecture in these autoimmune and cancer conditions.
title: Autoimmune Alleles at the Major Histocompatibility Locus Modify Melanoma Susceptibility

finding: The SNP rs13040892 was associated with genetic profiles of aggressive variants of papillary thyroid carcinomas, which indicated its relevance to the aggressive behavior and metastatic potential observed in thyroid cancer. This finding was contextualized in a study that correlated various SNPs with the histological characteristics and clinical outcomes of thyroid carcinoma, particularly highlighting the importance of TNC and its interaction with Wnt signaling pathways.
title: Tenascin-C potentiates Wnt signaling in thyroid cancer

finding: The study confirmed that this SNP, which corresponds to the mutation c.598G>A and results in the protein change p.Glu200Lys, is prevalent in the E200K mutation of the prion protein and is associated with genetic prion diseases.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: This SNP was identified in the study as c.385A>G leading to the amino acid change p.Met129Val, which has been recognized in relation to variant CJD risk.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: The presence of this SNP was confirmed by whole exome sequencing in the context of prion diseases, although specific details about its association were not elaborated in the findings.
title: NMDA receptor misalignment in iPSC-derived neurons from a multi-generational family with inherited Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease

finding: The variant rs6064377 was significantly associated with the latent factor ML6 and exhibited moderate evidence for association with hemoglobin concentration, hematocrit, and red blood cell count, affirming its role in erythropoiesis.
title: Improved genetic discovery and fine-mapping resolution through multivariate latent factor analysis of high-dimensional traits

finding: The variant rs4810479 was identified as having a nominally significant interaction effect related to total triglyceride levels in the context of current smoking. This SNP is located 4kb upstream of the PLTP gene, which encodes a phospholipid transfer protein. Studies referenced indicated that smoking influenced the expression of the PLTP gene, leading to increased PLTP activity in smokers, thereby demonstrating a gene-by-exposure interaction.
title: Genome-wide Interaction Studies by the CHARGE Gene-Lifestyle Interactions Working Group: what we’ve learned and what’s coming next

finding: The SNP rs6042155 was identified in the study by Chen et al. (2014), which examined viral carcinogenesis and its association with DNA damage and viral integration. It was found to be a significant marker related to the effects of viral integration on host genome stability.
title: Computational methods for the discovery and annotation of viral integrations

finding: The SNP rs6065717 was associated with the study on human land-use practices, which revealed that these practices led to global long-term increases in photosynthetic capacity. The findings indicated that environmental heterogeneity, influenced by land-use, could affect local biodiversity measures.
title: Predictability and transferability of local biodiversity environment relationships

finding: The Q93E polymorphism was significant in terms of a proteinase-targeted site, affecting the cleavability of MAVS. This alteration was noted to enhance CVB3 infectivity by removing the potential cleavage site, which otherwise could disrupt the signaling pathway, illustrating that this common polymorphism has important implications in the context of viral infection.
title: Modeling the complete kinetics of coxsackievirus B3 reveals human determinants of host-cell feedback

finding: The SNP rs6059655 in the RALY/ASIP genes was mentioned as associated with self-reported aging, contributing to insights on genetic links to facial aging.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs1205312 also in the RALY/ASIP genes was found to be related to self-reported aging, supporting findings in pigmentation-related gene functions.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs6088372, part of the RALY/ASIP genes, demonstrated an association with self-reported facial aging, underpinning the significance of pigmentation in facial age perceptions.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: The SNP rs2424995 from the PIGU gene was associated with self-reported facial aging, indicating that genes affecting pigmentation played a critical role in aging perceptions.
title: Biological insights from self-perceived facial aging data of the UKBB participants

finding: In the XBI cohort, the rare variant rs117919628 in the promoter region of GHRH was associated with a reduction in height of -0.32 s.d. and lower IGF-1 serum levels.
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The SNP rs1884302 demonstrated a P-value of 2.40e-10 in relation to BMP2 in the GWAS, linking it to cranial vault shape and its significance in sagittal craniosynostosis.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: Associated with BMP2, the SNP rs6054748 reached significant P-values and indicated an elongation and narrowing of the cranial vault, mimicking shapes seen in sagittal craniosynostosis patients.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: For SNP rs1573707, found within PTPRT, the association with IDL-Free cholesterol and IDL-phospholipids was confirmed. This finding suggested its involvement in cellular processes related to metabolism.
title: Recessive genetic effects on type 2 diabetes-related metabolites in a consanguineous population

finding: The rs867186 SNP in the PROCR gene was associated with cardiovascular risk factors, suggesting its potential involvement in cardiovascular events.
title: Identification of novel key genes and signaling pathways in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy: evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The SNP rs13040861 was linked to the FDA-approved antiviral Raltegravir, which inhibited fascin1-dependent invasion of colorectal tumor cells both in vitro and in vivo, suggesting its significance in cancer invasion mechanisms.
title: The Actin Bundling Protein Fascin Promotes Lung Cancer Growth and Metastasis by Enhancing Glycolysis and PFKFB3 Expression

finding: The SNP rs4911348 was associated with the gene expression of NECAB3, showing significant paternal and maternal effects in opposite directions. Both paternal and maternal alleles had an association with the phenotype, while the genotype itself did not.
title: Abundant Parent-of-origin Effect eQTL in Humans: The Framingham Heart Study

finding: This SNP exhibited positive regulatory activity for the TUBB1 gene specifically during HCort exposure, suggesting it has a stress-interactive role.
title: Common genetic variation impacts stress response in the brain

finding: The SNP rs77351827 was shown to be in strong LD with the structural variant PD_DEL_chr20_597, which consists of a 1.95kb intronic deletion within intron three of the gene LRRN4. This deletion spans two reference Alu mobile elements.
title: Genome-wide analysis of Structural Variants in Parkinson’s Disease using Short-Read Sequencing data

finding: The SNP rs4925386 related to colorectal cancer and offered insights into regulatory variants potentially influencing cancer drive mechanisms.
title: Allele-specific DNA methylation is increased in cancers and its dense mapping in normal plus neoplastic cells increases the yield of disease-associated regulatory SNPs

finding: The SNP rs6031298 was linked to increased production of MMP-9 and pro-inflammatory factors in PCa pTA-NKs. This highlighted a significant role of the SNP in promoting pro-angiogenic activities of NK cells in the tumor microenvironment, representing a novel finding in the study of prostate cancer.
title: Prostate cancer peripheral blood NK cells show enhanced CD9, CD49a, CXCR4, CXCL8, MMP-9 production, and secrete monocyte-recruiting and polarizing factors

finding: The rs867186 SNP, located in the protein C receptor (PROCR) gene, was related to seven phenotypes, including protein C levels and coronary heart disease, across three populations, emphasizing its role in blood coagulation and disease susceptibility.
title: Pleiotropic Variability Score: A Genome Interpretation Metric to Quantify Phenomic Associations of Genomic Variants

finding: Identified as a key intronic variant at MMP9 with significant implications for MMP-9 levels and related inflammatory processes, showing strong regulation of protein abundance.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing Based Analysis of Inflammation Biomarkers in the Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Consortium

finding: At the RBM38 locus for mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH), the PIP for rs737092 improved from 0.72 to 0.96 with the Blood-cV2F score. It was implicated by MPRA data-driven deep learning features and blood-specific enhancements. The variant showed strong linkage to the RBM38 gene and was associated with allele-specific activity and critical roles in hemoglobin regulation.
title: A consensus variant-to-function score to functionally prioritize variants for disease

finding: The study identified that the SNP rs169311 was associated with adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS) and was critical in abolishing enhancer activity in the developing somites when tested in zebrafish. This finding indicated that rs169311 downregulated PAX1 gene expression, implicating it in the pathogenesis of AIS. Furthermore, the enhancer activity of PEC7, which contains rs169311, was specifically characterized as female-associative in relation to the sexual dimorphism of AIS.
title: Deletion of Pax1 scoliosis-associated regulatory elements leads to a female-biased tail abnormality

finding: The SNP rs6137473 was identified as the lead SNP in a GWAS related to adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS). It was highlighted that rs169311 is in strong linkage disequilibrium with this lead SNP, suggesting that both SNPs are likely contributors to the genetic architecture of AIS.
title: Deletion of Pax1 scoliosis-associated regulatory elements leads to a female-biased tail abnormality

finding: The variant rs80311618 was linked to the regulation of CEBPB in myeloid cell types. It overlaps a myeloid-specific enhancer and was shown to play a significant role in regulating monocyte counts.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs6011779, located on CHRNA4, was recognized as a genome-wide significant locus for smoking cessation, consistent with prior reports.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association analyses leveraging alcohol use disorder findings identify novel loci for smoking behaviors in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs2273535 was identified as a sex-biased eQTL for the gene AURKA in skeletal muscle. The T allele was associated with increased AURKA expression in males (p = 9.02×10−27), while no significant association was found in females (p = 0.75). This sex-specific effect indicated that the regulation of AURKA could be important in understanding sex differences in muscle biology and cancer risk.
title: The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues

finding: The SNP rs3197744 within the 3' UTR of the SIRPA gene was found to correlate with platelet levels, showing a beta value of -0.023 and a remarkable p-value of 9.88e-32, emphasizing its genetic influence on platelet homeostasis.
title: SIRPα controls CD47-dependent platelet clearance in mice and humans

finding: The rs374587283 SNP associated with the CPNE1 gene was significant in five of six fibroblast types and also illustrated a significant interaction with the cell type, indicating its importance in the regulatory landscape of different fibroblast subtypes.
title: Single cell eQTL analysis identifies cell type-specific genetic control of gene expression in fibroblasts and reprogrammed induced pluripotent stem cells

finding: Variant rs16991615 in the MCM8 gene reached genome-wide significance (P=3.48×10^-10) and was associated with a per allele increase of 0.26 SD in age-adjusted inverse normal AMH levels in pre-menopausal women. It was previously linked to age at menopause, indicating a causal relationship between pre-menopausal AMH levels and menopause timing.
title: Genome-wide association study of anti-Müllerian hormone levels in pre-menopausal women of late reproductive age and relationship with genetic determinants of reproductive lifespan

finding: The rs2248137 MS effect on chromosome 20 was identified to colocalize with the cis-mQTL effect for cg14595058, which is located upstream of the CYP24A1 gene, indicating a significant relationship between MS susceptibility and methylation in this region.
title: Impact of genetic susceptibility to multiple sclerosis on the T cell epigenome: proximal and distal effects

finding: This SNP had associations with brain connectivity measurements, highlighting its neurobiological relevance.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: Similar effects were observed as for rs13063635, linked to various phenotypes related to autoimmunity.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The rs2618566 variant, located in a distal regulatory region associated with RRBP1, demonstrated a PIP of 1.00. This locus was recognized as a liver eQTL, pointing to a regulatory role of this region. Previous analysis suggested that carriers of rare coding variants in RRBP1 had significantly decreased LDL-C levels, and RRBP1 knockdown in mice was shown to disrupt lipid homeostasis, further supporting its role in LDL regulation.
title: Systematic elucidation of genetic mechanisms underlying cholesterol uptake

finding: The SNP rs13040922 was identified as a positive and original finding related to the detection of tumor-associated membrane receptors on extracellular vesicles from non-small cell lung cancer patients. This finding was detailed in the work by Stiller et al., highlighting its significance in cancer research.
title: Volumetric Semantic Instance Segmentation of the Plasma Membrane of HeLa Cells

finding: The SNP rs2089960995 in MAVS was identified as unique to donor 122, indicating a potential role in the high endogenous IFN response that conferred resistance to SARS-CoV-2.
title: An Endogenously activated antiviral state restricts SARS-CoV-2 infection in differentiated primary airway epithelial cells

finding: rs844881 was linked to the CD93 locus in Neutrophils and was found to significantly reduce the expression of THBD, CD93, and an lncRNA LINC00656, potentially impacting the development of varicose veins.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The SNP rs3787184 was located in NFATC2 and implicated in T-cell calcium signaling pathways, linking it to the pathophysiology of varicose veins.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and replication in 810,625 individuals identifies novel therapeutic targets for varicose veins

finding: The SNP rs13040739 was studied in the context of metformin's effects on histone modifications. Specifically, the original finding indicated that metformin reduced histone H3K4me3 at the promoter regions of positive cell cycle regulatory genes in lung cancer cells, suggesting a potential mechanism through which metformin could influence aging and cancer cell proliferation.
title: Metformin use history and genome-wide DNA methylation profile: potential molecular mechanism for aging and longevity

finding: The SNP rs13040595 was implicated in research connecting NK cell functionality to tumor dynamics. It was associated with increased efficacy in CAR-based therapies, particularly in the context of solid tumors. This finding emphasized the role of genetic variation in influencing the immune response against malignancies.
title: Augmenting CAR NK cell Anti-tumor Activity by Synapse Tuning

finding: The SNP rs4813319, located in the SHPS1 gene (SIRPA), was found to have a causal association with schizophrenia, supported by evidence from the UK Biobank data and a lack of significant heterogeneity in the results of the 2014 Schizophrenia Working Group study.
title: Proteome-by-phenome Mendelian Randomisation detects 38 proteins with causal roles in human diseases and traits

finding: The SNP rs1358782, intronic to RBCK1, exhibited a significant association with the Ribose 5-Phosphate gene set in astrocytes, demonstrated by a p-value of 7.29×10⁻⁵. This finding indicates its potential role in the pentose phosphate pathway.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: The lead i-rQTL variant rs1711194 was located downstream of the DNTTIP1 gene, influencing its monocyte-specific isoform DNTTIP1-202, and was associated with significant i-rQTL effects in multiple immune subsets.
title: Splicing QTL analysis focusing on coding sequences reveals pathogenicity of disease susceptibility loci

finding: This SNP exhibited a large negative effect on Very Large HDL and a large positive effect on Small HDL, despite both traits being positively correlated. The analysis confirmed the opposing effects in univariate regressions, qualifying it as a compelling candidate for further research.
title: Multivariate Genomewide Association Analysis by Iterative Hard Thresholding

finding: The SNP rs6087632 was associated with the development of a novel bidirectional canopy reflectance model for row-planted rice and wheat, as detailed in a study by Zhou et al. in 2014. The finding indicated that this SNP potentially plays a role in enhancing the understanding of canopy photosynthesis in relation to genetic factors influencing plant growth.
title: Development of a Two-Leaf Photosynthetic Model Sensitive to Chlorophyll and Its Coupling with a Wheat Growth Model

finding: The SNP rs143384, located in the GDF5 gene, showed a significant association with knee pain, with a P value of 1.32 × 10<sup>−12</sup> in the UK Biobank. This SNP was replicated in subsequent stages with P values of 2.44 × 10<sup>−9</sup> and 0.01, demonstrating its relevance to osteoarthritis-related knee pain.
title: A genome-wide association study identifies that the GDF5 and COL27A1 genes are associated with knee pain in UK Biobank (N = 171, 516)

finding: The research indicated that the rs2740210 variant of the Oxytocin receptor gene (Oxtr) was similarly associated with an elevated risk of depression in pregnant women facing early abuse. This finding further reinforced the role of OXTR polymorphisms in shaping social phenotypes and emotional responses, illustrating the impact of genetic variations on mental health outcomes related to life experiences.
title: Natural variation in oxytocin receptor signaling causes widespread changes in brain transcription: a link to the natural killer gene complex

finding: The missense variant rs115287948 was found to have a direct orthologue in cattle and was identified as a causative regulatory variant linked to the expression of the SIRPB1 gene across multiple tissues, demonstrating conserved functional effects.
title: The conservation of human functional variants and their effects across mammals

finding: The SNP rs1883832 was associated with multiple sclerosis (MS) through colocalization analysis with the expression quantitative trait loci (eQTL) near the CD40 gene in cortex tissue, implicating its role in immune responsiveness linked to viral mechanisms.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The SNP rs6074022 was linked to multiple sclerosis by affecting the expression of CD40 in both cortex and whole blood, emphasizing its critical role in the inflammatory response mechanisms associated with the disease.
title: Identification and catalogue of viral transcriptional regulators in human diseases

finding: The rs13040826 SNP was found to be associated with the targeting of CXCR4 by the naturally occurring antagonist EPI-X4 in the context of Waldenström's Macroglobulinemia. The original finding linked this SNP to the modulation of CXCR4 signaling, which is significant given its implications for chemoresistance in hematologic malignancies such as AML.
title: CXCL12 chemokine dimer signaling modulates acute myelogenous leukemia cell migration through altered receptor internalization

finding: The SNP rs13040922 was identified in a study by Stiller et al. in 2021, where it was linked to the detection of tumor-associated membrane receptors on extracellular vesicles from patients with non-small cell lung cancer. This finding suggested that addressing this SNP could enhance the methods for detecting early-stage lung cancer through immuno-PCR assays.
title: Colocalization of Cancer Associated Biomarkers on Single Extracellular Vesicles for Early Cancer Detection

finding: The SNP rs3827066 was associated with increased expression of the gene CTSA in the context of stimulated immune cells, specifically after stimulation with sLPS or LIL10 at the 24-hour time point. This association was not detected in naive conditions, thereby categorizing it as a response eQTL (reQTL). Furthermore, this SNP was previously linked to risks of Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA). The colocalization with CAD GWAS data indicated that the variant influenced CTSA regulation, contributing to increased oxidative stress and inflammation, consistent with processes involved in CAD pathogenesis.
title: Gene expression QTL mapping in stimulated iPSC-derived macrophages provides insights into common complex diseases

finding: The SNP rs6042155 was associated with the mechanisms inducing DNA damage and resultant viral integration in Merkel Cell Carcinoma (MCC). The research suggested that this SNP was linked to cellular DNA repair pathways, highlighting its role in the integration of Merkel cell polyomavirus (MCPyV) genomes, contributing to the oncogenic process.
title: High-resolution analysis of Merkel Cell Polyomavirus in Merkel Cell Carcinoma reveals distinct integration patterns and suggests NHEJ and MMBIR as underlying mechanisms

finding: The rs6060369 locus was found to be associated with height, as reported by large Genome-Wide Association Studies (GWAS). This finding confirmed its relevance in the context of phenotypic traits related to human height.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: The rs1800961 locus was associated with High-Density Lipoprotein (HDL) levels. This association was previously documented in large GWAS as well as in meta-analysis studies, validating its significance in lipid metabolism.
title: Leveraging allelic heterogeneity to increase power of association testing

finding: The variant rs2232607 in the LBP gene exhibited negative selection, suggesting a selection pressure against variants impacting immune responses, particularly after the Bronze Age.
title: Genetic adaptation to pathogens and increased risk of inflammatory disorders in post-Neolithic Europe

finding: The minor C-allele of rs6123471, located in the non-coding 3' UTR of KIAA1755, was associated with lower expression of KIAA1755 and higher HRV in humans, corroborating the findings in zebrafish embryos where mutations in si:dkey-65j6.2 resulted in higher HRV without affecting heart rate at both 2 and 5 dpf. This indicates a plausible genetic association between KIAA1755 and HRV.
title: Translating GWAS-identified loci for cardiac rhythm and rate using an in vivo image- and CRISPR/Cas9-based approach

finding: Positioned near CYP24A1, this SNP was associated with higher vitamin D and serum Ca levels, indicating implications for nephrolithiasis.
title: GWAS identifies nine nephrolithiasis susceptibility loci related with metabolic metabolic and crystallization pathways

finding: The SNP rs6024870, located at the LOAD GWAS <italic>CASS4</italic> locus, was shown to physically contact the promoter of the neighboring gene <italic>RTFDC1</italic>. The protective minor A allele of this SNP was associated with reduced expression of <italic>RTFDC1</italic> in human microglial cell models. Functional validation revealed that deletion of the regulatory element harboring rs6024870 resulted in increased secretion of pro-inflammatory cytokines and diminished DNA double strand break repair capacity. Thus, rs6024870 influenced microglial inflammatory responses and DNA damage resolution.
title: Variant-to-function mapping of late-onset Alzheimer’s disease GWAS signals in human microglial cell models implicates RTFDC1 at the CASS4 locus

finding: For SNP rs6141383 within the BPIFB1 gene, with a discovery P-value also around 10^-4, replication was achieved in the second study. The Mix Bayes estimate reported an OR of 1.31 with a 95% posterior interval of (0.73 – 2.36), suggesting a possible positive association although with wider ranges.
title: Quantifying posterior effect size distribution of susceptibility loci by common summary statistics

finding: The SNP rs1800961 was connected to liver health, harboring a missense mutation strongly associated with high-density lipoprotein levels and total cholesterol, highlighting its role in liver-related traits.
title: Mechanisms of tissue-specific genetic regulation revealed by latent factors across eQTLs

finding: At rs6120849 near EDEM2, light alleles decreased in frequency more than could be explained by changes in ancestry, potentially indicating selective pressures.
title: The evolution of skin pigmentation associated variation in West Eurasia

finding: The SNP rs13040739 was associated with lung cancer cells in the context of histone modification, as evidenced by the research led by Kim et al. in 2021. The study demonstrated that Metformin treatment reduced the histone mark H3K4me3 at the promoter regions of positive cell cycle regulatory genes, highlighting the role of this SNP in the regulation of gene expression related to cancer progression.
title: Global identification of direct SWI/SNF targets reveals compensation by EP400

finding: The SNP rs13040715 was associated with the adaptive molecular mechanisms in prostate cancer cells in response to anti-androgen therapy. This association was identified in a study that analyzed proteomic profiles of prostate cancer cells, highlighting its relevance in cancer progression.
title: Identification of a Micropeptide Linked to Cancer Stem Cell Regulation and Chemoresistance

finding: The SNP rs6013897 was part of the significant findings associated with 25OHD concentration.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 143 loci associated with 25 hydroxyvitamin D concentration

finding: The SNP rs13040870 was associated with the dysregulation of erythroid progenitor cells, particularly in tumor immune evasion. This relation highlighted its role in the modulation of immune responses, as evidenced by the correlation between CECs expansion and immune suppression, particularly T-cell activity and proliferation. This finding contributed to the understanding of how genetic variations could influence the development and function of immune-regulatory cells in both anemia and cancer contexts.
title: Potent but transient immunosuppression of T-cells is a general feature of CD71+ erythroid cells

finding: The SNP rs6020829 was associated with the multifaceted roles of STAT3 signaling in prostate cancer progression. This finding indicated a potential mechanism through which genetic variations could lead to altered signaling pathways, thereby affecting the behavior of cancerous cells related to ERG activation and contributing to the overall tumor development.
title: ERG activates a stem-like proliferation-differentiation program in prostate epithelial cells with mixed basal-luminal identity

finding: The rs17216707 SNP, located ~38kb upstream of CYP24A1, was associated with increased serum calcium concentrations in individuals homozygous for the increased-risk allele (T), compared to those with the reduced-risk allele (C). Specifically, homozygotes (TT) had a mean serum calcium concentration of 2.36mmol/l, while heterozygotes (TC) had a mean of 2.32mmol/l. Furthermore, these individuals also experienced more kidney stone episodes (mean of 4.0 episodes for TT vs. 2.4 for TC), supporting the hypothesis that this allele is associated with hypercalcemia and increased stone recurrence.
title: Genetic variants of calcium and vitamin D metabolism in kidney stone disease

finding: The c.7210G>C variant in the CHD6 gene was identified as a heterozygote advantageous variant in this study, possibly linked to influenza virus replication, and showed deleterious predictions through in silico tools.
title: Hardy-Weinberg Equilibrium in the Large Scale Genomic Sequencing Era

finding: The variant rs1569960 showed a strong <italic>cis</italic> association with the SIRPA protein level (MAF = 0.34, P = 2.67 × 10^-106), along with four independent signals in the SIRPA <italic>cis</italic> region.
title: Genetic determinants of plasma protein levels in the Estonian population

finding: This SNP was associated with age at smoking initiation and has shown correlation with lung cancer, linking it to the genetic factors associated with nicotine dependence.
title: Expanding the Genetic Architecture of Nicotine Dependence and its Shared Genetics with Multiple Traits: Findings from the Nicotine Dependence GenOmics (iNDiGO) Consortium

finding: This nonsynonymous SNP was associated with longevity through the allele A, while also being linked to increased risk for breast cancer with its alternative allele.
title: A joint analysis of longevity and age-related disease variants for gene expression association

finding: The SNP rs4239702 was strongly associated with the total expression level of CD40 in monocyte eQTL studies, demonstrating its significant connection to rheumatoid arthritis (RA) as part of a colocalisation signal. This relationship was backed by multiple eQTL studies involving RNA-seq and microarray data.
title: eQTL Catalogue: a compendium of uniformly processed human gene expression and splicing QTLs

finding: The SNP rs541005701 was also identified as a significant QTL for orotidine on chromosome 20, with findings supporting its potential impact on the levels of this metabolite with p < 1e-17.
title: yQTL Pipeline: a structured computational workflow for large scale quantitative trait loci discovery and downstream visualization

finding: The SNP rs116843836, located upstream of the RSPO4 gene, was also established as a significant finding in the conjFDR analysis connecting MSA with IBD/CD. This SNP was part of a lead locus that demonstrated potential involvement in the genetic architecture linking these diseases, although it showed less evidence of colocalization with eQTL signals compared to rs12740041 and rs4957144.
title: A genome-wide genetic pleiotropy approach identified shared loci between multiple system atrophy and inflammatory bowel disease

finding: This SNP was found associated with RMI within the PTPRT gene at the 20q12 region, presenting a p-value of 9.70×10−8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: This SNP replicated for both RMM and RMI, located in intron 18 of the PTPRT gene, indicating a narrow signal around 20 kb that suggested consistency across different exposure levels.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The study found that female carriers of the OXTR rs4813625 'C' allele exhibited greater stress-induced dopamine release when subjected to a physical and emotional stressor. This was assessed through decreases in dopamine receptor availability measured using PET imaging. The finding indicates a significant genetic influence of the OXTR SNP on dopaminergic pathways, particularly in relation to stress responses in women.
title: The Creative Mind: Blending Oxytocinergic, Dopaminergic and Personality

finding: The SNP rs6079582 was located at 20p12.1 in the gene body of MACROD2 and demonstrated consistent association signals across various studies (UKB discovery p = 1e-29, UKB replication p = 1.7e-18, ABCD replication p = 4.6e-8). This SNP was implicated in cognitive ability and autism, alongside its association with motor functions, supported by findings in knockout mouse experiments.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association studies on the tissue compartments of human brain identify novel loci underpinning brain development and neuropsychiatric outcomes

finding: The SNP rs197819 was part of a study on simulated datasets, where an association signal was created on Chromosome 20 by simulating an excess of FGR haplotypes that carried the alternative allele for the variant rs197819. This finding demonstrated the effectiveness of the SURFBAT method for identifying more precise association signals near rs197819, in contrast to traditional GWAS approaches that produced significant p-values up to 0.5Mb away from this SNP.
title: SURFBAT: a surrogate family-based association test building on large imputation reference panels

finding: The SNP rs1186715161 was associated with a predicted complete knockout of the HAO1 gene in a healthy individual, demonstrated by an ultra-rare homozygous frameshift variant leading to truncation of the final 37 amino acids of the protein. While this individual exhibited significantly elevated plasma and urinary glycolate levels, the absence of clinical phenotypes and normal oxalate levels suggested that complete HAO1 knockout may not produce adverse effects, indicating potential safety for therapeutic inhibition of HAO1 in treating conditions like Primary Hyperoxaluria Type 1.
title: Deep phenotyping of a healthy human HAO1 knockout informs therapeutic development for primary hyperoxaluria type 1

finding: The SNP rs6086929 was identified as being associated with biomass production (BP) and nitrogen uptake (N_up) in forest ecosystems. This association was particularly relevant as the study compiled measurements from 804 forest and grassland sites and demonstrated how climatic factors such as growth temperature and vapour pressure deficit influenced these processes. The finding indicated that variations in this SNP could influence nitrogen use efficiency (NUE) and overall nitrogen cycling, which are critical for understanding the coupling of carbon and nitrogen cycles in terrestrial ecosystems.
title: Global terrestrial nitrogen uptake and nitrogen use efficiency

finding: The SNP rs6042718 was associated with findings from the study by Siswanto and Tanaka regarding the dynamics of phytoplankton biomass in the Strait of Malacca, highlighting seasonal cycles and interannual variations observed from the SeaWiFS mission. It suggested a genetic basis for understanding the marine microbial communities in relation to environmental changes.
title: Temporal dynamics of Bacteria, Archaea and protists in equatorial coastal waters

finding: SNP rs150246290, located at the MACROD2 locus on chromosome 20, exhibited genome-wide significance (OR: 3.78, p=1.27×10^-10) specifically in patients diagnosed with transposition of the great arteries (TGA). It was suggested to be a possible causal variant.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: Another SNP at the MACROD2 locus, rs149890280, showed genome-wide significance with an OR of 3.74 and p=1.8×10^-10 in patients with transposition of the great arteries (TGA), marking it as a significant risk factor.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs149467721 located at the MACROD2 locus also reached genome-wide significance (OR: 3.53, p=1.39×10^-9) in the TGA cohort. Its identification reinforced the role of this locus in CHD.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The SNP rs77094733, also at the MACROD2 locus, exhibited genome-wide significance (OR: 3.53, p=1.73×10^-9) in TGA patients, further confirming the association of this locus with the CHD phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: SNP rs490514 was validated in the CHD population, confirming its significance as previously reported for septal defects in a different cohort.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: This variant, located in <italic>MCM8</italic>, was identified as likely causal, specifically referred to as p.E341K, indicating a potential link to breast cancer risk.
title: Fine-mapping of 150 breast cancer risk regions identifies 178 high confidence target genes

finding: The SNP rs67002563 showed a genome-wide significant non-additive association with red blood cell distribution width (P = 2.99 × 10⁻¹¹), although it did not reach significance under an additive model (P = 0.000152).
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The rs1127354 SNP, a non-synonymous variant in the ITPA gene, was fine-mapped as contributing to the non-additive signal associated with red blood cell distribution width, known to predict drug-induced anemia in chronic HCV patients.
title: Analysis of genetic dominance in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs13040890 was associated with the gene INPPL1, known to code for SHIP2, which is implicated in Opsismodysplasia. The study found that mutations in the INPPL1 gene affect mineralization processes, specifically impacting the extracellular matrix mineralization in chondrocytes and osteoblasts. This finding was significant as it connected the SNP to the mineralization phenotype linked to bone development defects.
title: SHIP2 controls matrix mineralization by regulation of the RhoA/ROCK pathway and remodeling of the actin cytoskeleton

finding: The SNP rs6031597 was identified in the context of its role in DNA mismatch repair (MMR) and oxidative DNA damage, indicating its relevance to cancer biology and treatment. Research suggested that variants related to this SNP could influence the efficiency of MMR mechanisms, particularly in how D-type cyclins regulate MMR in the G1 phase, potentially impacting genomic stability.
title: D-type cyclins regulate DNA mismatch repair in the G1 and S phases of the cell cycle, maintaining genome stability

finding: rs6065253 was associated with breast cancer, showing genome-wide significance. It was identified in a meta-analysis involving 237,483 cases.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: rs6065254 showed a significant association with breast cancer through a model considering tumor grade and hormone receptor status, affirming its relevance in cancer susceptibility.
title: Combining genome-wide studies of breast, prostate, ovarian and endometrial cancers maps cross-cancer susceptibility loci and identifies new genetic associations

finding: The frameshift deletion variant was associated with reduced height and IGF-1 levels, showing an effect size of -0.63 s.d. for height (95% CI 0.36-0.89, p = 4.6·10⁻⁶) and -0.74 s.d. for IGF-1 (95% CI 0.49-0.99, p = 4.9·10⁻⁹).
title: The sequences of 150,119 genomes in the UK biobank

finding: The SNP rs6042049 was previously associated with the regulation of the myb transcription factor, which influences differentiation, the cell cycle, and oncogenesis. This finding indicated that variations at this SNP could impact the expression and regulation of genes involved in crucial biological processes, thereby linking it to potential implications in cancer development.
title: Impacts of nucleosome positioning elements and pre-assembled chromatin states on expression and retention of transgenes

finding: The SNP rs117020124 showed a significant modification of the parent-of-origin effect (POE) on the methylation of cg18035618, which is located in an intron of the GNAS gene. The modification was influenced by lifetime smoking status, with current smokers exhibiting a larger contrast in methylation levels between heterozygous groups.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: The SNP rs117823351 had a significant interaction with the POE of cg18035618. It was found that the modification was influenced by predicted mRNA expression levels of SIRT1, leading to increased contrast in methylation levels for individuals with lower SIRT1 expression.
title: Lifestyle and Genetic Factors Modify Parent-of-Origin Effects on the Human Methylome

finding: The SNP rs6039642 demonstrated an association with mean cortical thickness variability, again indicating significant genetic influence (p = 2.1×10^-8) and explaining 0.259% of the variance in cortical thickness. This presented a novel understanding of genetic factors affecting cortical thickness variation.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: This locus correlated with rs6039642, which was associated with mean cortical thickness variability and presented significant genetic implications toward controlling variability in cortical structured measurements.
title: Genetic control of variability in subcortical and intracranial volumes

finding: The SNP rs13720 was linked to the tssB gene in A. jandaei DSM 7311, suggesting its relevance in the engineered delivery systems for antibacterial applications.
title: Engineering a customizable antibacterial T6SS-based platform in Vibrio natriegens

finding: The SNP rs6031769 was associated with drug resistance in cancer, as indicated by its mention in a study that explored various genetic factors contributing to drug resistance mechanisms. The study reported a comprehensive assessment of supporting cells in tumor microenvironments and identified several candidate genes, suggesting that genetic variations at this locus may impact treatment outcomes in cancer patients.
title: Indirect CRISPR screening with photoconversion revealed key factors of drug resistance with cell–cell interactions

finding: The SNP rs112149412 was found to be significant for PTSD in the African sample (p=3.18×10−8) and was positioned near the BMP2 gene.
title: Genomic Characterization of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder in a Large US Military Veteran Sample

finding: The rs6060369 risk variant in the R4 regulatory region caused statistically significant morphological changes to femoral condyles and tibial plateaus in mice, resulting in a 30% increase in knee osteoarthritis (OA) risk, mirroring changes seen in patients.
title: Complex regulatory interactions at GDF5 shape joint morphology and osteoarthritis disease risk

finding: The rs4911178 risk variant in the GROW1 enhancer led to alterations in acetabular and femoral neck shape, but not the knee joint, in mouse models. This finding was consistent with observations in DDH patients who carried the same risk allele.
title: Complex regulatory interactions at GDF5 shape joint morphology and osteoarthritis disease risk

finding: This variant was confirmed to disrupt ATF6 binding and significantly reduced CASS4 gene expression in differentiated THP-1 cells.
title: Functional regulatory variants implicate distinct transcriptional networks in dementia

finding: This SNP was included in the set of genetic variants robustly associated with vitamin D and supported by earlier findings linking vitamin D with potential health benefits.
title: An atlas on causal role of circulating vitamin D concentrations in human complex traits and diseases

finding: The SNP rs13040727 was linked to PARP inhibitors in small-cell lung cancer, pointing to its importance in rational combinations to improve therapeutic responses.
title: A bi-functional PARP-HDAC inhibitor with activity in Ewing sarcoma

finding: The PROCR rs867186 SNP was associated with cardiovascular risk factors and events in patients with coronary artery disease, suggesting its importance as a marker for cardiovascular health.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: The TRIB3 rs6037475 variant was proposed as a potential biomarker for predicting drug response in hypertensive patients, underlining its relevance in pharmaceutical genetics.
title: The Identification of Key Genes and Biological Pathways in Cardiac Arrest by Integrated Bioinformatics and Next Generation Sequencing Data Analysis

finding: Variants rs115662534 and rs548231435 were identified as potential markers of autoimmune diseases, disrupting the binding of important transcription factors to the regulatory elements of the CD40 gene.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: Variants rs115662534 and rs548231435 were associated with autoimmune diseases, indicating their significance in the regulation of immune responses.
title: Bioinformatics and next generation data analysis reveals the potential role of inflammation in sepsis and its associated complications

finding: The SNP rs398123017, with a delta chi-square of -28.7, was noted for having an unknown function but was identified as influencing the association with IPF. It had previously been associated with familial and sporadic melanoma and thyroid cancer, suggesting its role in increasing transcription of the TERT gene and maintaining telomerase activity, thereby contributing to tumorigenesis.
title: Identification of Influential Variants in Significant Aggregate Rare Variant Tests

finding: The SNP rs373740199, assigned a delta chi-square of -17.5, was found in a non-coding RNA transcript in the 5' UTR of the TERT gene and also indicated as influencing the association with IPF. This variant, like rs398123017, was previously connected to malignancies, playing a role in enhancing TERT transcription and sustaining telomerase function related to cancer development.
title: Identification of Influential Variants in Significant Aggregate Rare Variant Tests

finding: The SNP rs13040692 was identified in a study that explored the molecular and functional links between neurodevelopmental processes and treatment-induced neuroendocrine plasticity in prostate cancer progression. The original findings suggested that this SNP could be related to mechanisms influencing cancer cell behavior, potentially impacting metastasis.
title: Video tracking of single cells to identify clustering behaviour

finding: The SNP rs77617917 was linked to the PCIF1 gene, which is in close proximity to the gene encoding the phospholipid transfer protein. This SNP was also associated with cholesterol quantity in medium-sized HDLs, demonstrating its role in HDL functionality measurements as part of the study's focus on HDL characteristics and CAD risk.
title: High-density lipoprotein characteristics and coronary heart disease: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: Variant rs742710 was noted in Patient 12 and, although not predicted to be deleterious, had a significant allele frequency of 0.107 and was previously associated with early onset amyotrophic lateral sclerosis and implicated in multiple sclerosis and other neural diseases.
title: Rare disease research workflow using multilayer networks elucidates the molecular determinants of severity in Congenital Myasthenic Syndromes

finding: The missense variant rs201013770 (p.Phe517Ser) in ACSS1 showed a mean increase in serum acetate level of 0.005 mmol/l, linking it to metabolic pathways associated with obesity and insulin resistance.
title: Exome sequencing identifies high-impact trait-associated alleles enriched in Finns

finding: The rs910873 variant was linked to elevated ASIP serum levels, implicating it in melanoma risk. This relationship also highlighted the SNP's role as both a pQTL and eQTL, influencing ASIP gene expression.
title: Human serum proteome profoundly overlaps with genetic signatures of disease

finding: The SNP rs142951578 was found to be a predicted deleterious variant in the NCOA3 gene, leading to a p.Ser937Cys amino acid substitution. This substitution occurred in a highly conserved region among primates. The variant was associated with non-syndromic, sensorineural hearing loss in a large family, fitting within the linkage data that suggested a causative mutation. Several prediction tools indicated that this variant was damaging, which supported a potential role of NCOA3 in hereditary hearing loss.
title: NCOA3 identified as a new candidate to explain autosomal dominant progressive hearing loss

finding: The SNP rs12481228, a missense variant of CPNE1, was associated with increased ALM and suggested to have detrimental effects on CPNE1 structure, highlighting its functional importance in muscle mass.
title: Genome-wide associations reveal human-mouse genetic convergence and modifiers of myogenesis, CPNE1 and STC2

finding: The SNP rs6031670 was linked to tumor-associated macrophages, which were recognized as significant contributors in the tumor microenvironment. This finding provided insights into the role of macrophage activity and its modulation within pathological contexts.
title: Immediate and sustained effects of cobalt and zinc-containing pigments on macrophages

finding: The SNP rs6020897 was identified in the context of its association with STAT3 target genes relevant to human cancers. In the study by Carpenter and Lo (2014), it was emphasized that the activity of STAT3 plays a critical role in cancer pathways, particularly in HPV-positive cervical cancer. This SNP was noted as being pertinent to the signaling mechanisms that could drive oncogenic processes, suggesting its potential significance in therapeutic targeting.
title: Autocrine STAT3 activation in HPV positive cervical cancer through a virus-driven Akt - NFκB - IL-6 signalling axis

finding: The SNP rs2275294 in the regulatory region of the ZNF512B gene was associated with the prognosis in patients with Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) in several meta-studies. The expression levels of ZNF512B were observed to be elevated in brain and some cancer tissues, which could lead to disease-promoting protein and DNA aggregation. This SNP's influence on ZNF512B expression suggests a potential involvement in neurodegenerative diseases characterized by protein aggregation.
title: ZNF512B binds RBBP4 via a variant NuRD interaction motif and aggregates chromatin in a NuRD complex-independent manner

finding: The rs4911494 variant, UQCC1<R51Q</sub>, was associated with decreased arm fat mass but showed trends towards less fat in all peripheral and subcutaneous fat depots, indicating potential broader effects on fat distribution despite its primary association with arm fat.
title: Regional fat depot masses are influenced by protein-coding gene variants

finding: The SNP rs6031408 was related to the role of STAT3 in cancer. The research underscored the dual role of STAT3 as either promoting or inhibiting tumor progression depending on the context, linking it to its modulation by GP130 signaling pathways in prostate cancer outcomes.
title: Cell-autonomous GP130 activation suppresses prostate cancer development via STAT3/ARF/p53-driven senescence and confers an immune-active tumor microenvironment

finding: The rs214830_G>C pQTL for TGM3 was associated with skin cancer with ppHc=0.75, linking TGM3 to the development of basal cell carcinoma.
title: CoPheScan: phenome-wide association studies accounting for linkage disequilibrium

finding: The SNP rs143383 was identified as a susceptibility factor for osteoarthritis through the regulation of GDF5 expression. This finding related to the transcriptional factors that affect GDF5 expression and demonstrated its significant role in the pathogenesis of osteoarthritis, which is a relevant phenotype associated with joint development.
title: A single cell transcriptional atlas of early synovial joint development

finding: The SNP rs910805 was found to be significantly associated with Autism Spectrum Disorders (ASD) in the largest GWAS meta-analysis that included 18,381 ASD cases and 27,969 controls, yielding a p-value of 2.04 × 10^-9. This finding highlighted its relevance in understanding the genetic architecture of ASD.
title: UTMOST, A Novel Single And Cross-Tissue TWAS (Transcriptome Wide Association Study), Reveals New ASD (Autism Spectrum Disorder) Associated Genes
